chandler_dialogue: (glares at him) I hope he did!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Yeah. (Pause) Hey, I hope Ross didn't think that we just went in there because we were uncomfortable being out here!"]

chandler_dialogue: Joey, it's been three days, okay.. Your just a little homesick, Okay. Would you just try to relax. Just, just try to enjoy yourself.
intervening_dialogues: ['Mrs. Waltham: Lovely to meet you.', 'Mr. Waltham: Terribly nice of you to offer to pay for half the wedding. (He hands a multipage bill to Jack.)', "Mr. Geller: Ohh forget it. chandler_dialogue: I'd like to toast, Ross and Emily. Of course, my big toast will be tomorrow at the wedding, so this is kind of my little toast or Melba toast, if you will. (No one in the room laughs. He starts to get flustered.) Okay. I known Ross for a long time. In fact, I knew him when he was going out with his first girlfriend. (Ross looks embarrassed.) And I thought things were going to work out for him.. Until the day he over inflated her. (He laughs. Jack looks at Judy and no one in the room laughs.) Ohh, Dear God.. (A cellular phone rings.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Mr. Waltham: Ahh, then you have to give us the lawn ornaments.', "Ross: I go back there with lawn ornaments, he's going to laugh in my face.", 'Mrs. Waltham: This is ridiculous. I mean we had an agreement. (Ross looks frustrated. She begins to scream at her husband.) Will you say something, Steven?! Please!!!', "Mr. Waltham: Don't take that tone with me. (She looks evilly at him.) All-all right you can. (He looks over at Ross and Shrugs.)", "[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is dialling the phone and Rachel runs in the door.]", 'Rachel: (Running to her room.) Hi, Pheebs.', "Phoebe: (Looking relieved. She puts down the phone.) Oh thank god. Oh, you changed your mind. Oh, look I know you probably want to be alone, and you don't want to talk about it, that's fine. I just want you to know, I think you are doing the right thing and...", 'Rachel: (Running back out the door with her passport.) Bye, Pheebs.', 'Phoebe: (Trying to get up.) Wait!! Where are you going?! What are you doing?! No!! Wait!! (Not able to get up.) God!! Why am I always pregnant when she does that?!', '[Scene: The Rehearsal Dinner Hall. Chandler, Joey, Ross, Emily, Monica, and all the bridal party are seated at the table. Chandler gets up to make a toast. He clinks his glass, but the napkin is still in the glass. Needless to say, it sounds weird. He takes out the napkin and clinks his glass again.]']

chandler_dialogue: (Continuing his toast.) And I'm sure we're all very excited that Ross and Emily are getting married at Montgomery Hall. I mean to think, my friend getting married in Monty Hall. (No reaction from the people.) Ohh, come on!! Monty Hall!! Lets make a Deal!! Come on, you people!! All right, forget it!! Congratulations, Ross and Emily. (He sits down.)

chandler_dialogue: So how are you doing?

chandler_dialogue: Because he's crazy. Okay? He came up to me earlier and thanked me for my very moving performance in Titanic.

intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Meth-methane smells', "Caitlin: Y'know what umm, actually I, I really, I should go.", "Ross: Oh but I-I-I haven't paid you yet!", "Caitlin: Y'know what? That's okay, you guys have ordered so many that this one is on me! (Runs for her life.)", 'Ross: (To All) Was I talking to her about gas?']

chandler_dialogue: Almost over man.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: (entering) Hey Ross? Umm, I just ran into Caitlin in the hallway and-and uh, you must be getting better at this flirting stuff than I thought.', 'Ross: What do you mean?', "Rachel: Well, I don't get it, but she wanted me to give you her phone number. (Hands him the slip of paper with the phone number on it.)", 'Ross: And she just gave you this?', 'Rachel: Yeah!', "Ross: Rach, thanks but uh, I don't need you doing me any favors.", "Rachel: I-I-I didn't! I didn't! She thought you were cute.", 'Ross: Well that I can believe.', 'Rachel: Yay!', 'Joey: (entering) Hey! Is the show still on?']

chandler_dialogue: Why am I looking?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: (says hi to his grandma) Look! Oh! (Pointing out the window.) Is that the Pope?! (Chandler and his grandma turn to look and Joey slips a tape into the VCR.)']

chandler_dialogue: You couldn't have at least changed your shirt.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Oh, here I am, here's my big scene!", "Joey: (on the tape) All right back off! I gotta gun! I'm not afraid to use it!", 'Grandma Tribbiani: Oh Joey!', "Joey: That's right!"]

chandler_dialogue: (singing) Ground control to Major Tom! Commencing countdownengineson!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: (on the tape) Now, I wanna a suitcase filled with 100,000 dollars. (The duck quacks, to the duck) Choo! Choo! Choo! (To the imaginary cops) Filled with $100,000 in small bills, and if I don't get it(the duck quacks louder) Choo!! And if I don't get it, (pause, picks up the duck) I'm gonna shoot this duck!", 'Phoebe: Oh no!', "Joey: (on the tape) I'm comin' out! (He opens the door and hops out pointing the gun in all directions and then runs out of view.)", "Ross: (To Phoebe) And she's supposed to buy this?!", 'Grandma Tribbiani: Joey, bravo! (Starts with that Italian stuff again.)']

chandler_dialogue: (To Monica) Hey!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: (to his grandmother) That's uh, scenes from next week's show. Next week's!", 'Phoebe: I am definitely gonna watch that!', "[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, another time lapse, Monica is seeking advice from Rachel and Phoebe about possible replacement earrings.]", 'Monica: What about these? These look the same?', 'Phoebe: Definitely!', 'Monica: Not as each other!', 'Phoebe: Oh, then no.']

chandler_dialogue: You ready?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Hi!']

chandler_dialogue: You look amazing. I'm the luckiest man in the world.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Yeah.']

chandler_dialogue: Let me see the earrings.
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Ohh, you're about to get a little luckier."]

chandler_dialogue: (looking at them) They look great! Does your boyfriend have the best taste or what?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Oh, honey, the earrings']

chandler_dialogue: (To Ross) Thanks for picking out the earrings man.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: My boyfriend really does have good taste!']

chandler_dialogue: Hey man, what's up?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Hm-mmm.', 'Written by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan & Seth Kurland Transcribed by: Eric Aasen', '[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Rachel, Joey, and Monica are sitting on the couch as Ross is up getting some coffee.]', "Monica: Okay, guys, listen, don't forget that tomorrow is the day that Emily gets married again, so whatever we do, just try to really keep Ross's mind off of it.", 'Joey: Oh, yeah, good idea.']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah, yeah! Me too!
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: (entering, with Gary) Hey!', 'Gary: Hello!', 'Monica: Hey!', 'Gary: How are you?', "Phoebe: Monica, I'm sorry I didn't come by last night. I was out with Gary; he let me ride around with him in his cop car. We saw and prevented crimes.", 'Joey: You got to go on a ride along?!', 'Phoebe: Uh-huh!', 'Joey: I want to go on a ride along!', 'Ross: Me too!', 'Gary: Okay!']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah.
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: Really?! You?']

chandler_dialogue: Well, I like danger.
intervening_dialogues: ["Gary: Well, it's kinda dangerous."]

chandler_dialogue: Tonight? You-you didn't say it was going to be at nighttime.
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: Okay, you guys free tonight?', 'Joey and Ross: Yeah!!']

chandler_dialogue: It is starting to get dark out there.
intervening_dialogues: ["Rachel: Ohhhh. Honey, honey, honey, it's okay, it's okay honey. I'm gonna fix you a drink, huh? Maybe a margarita?", "Ross: Ross has the blender! Ugh, everything's just falling apart!", "Rachel: No honey, it's okay! Listen, I'll got to Ross's and get the blender, you get all the margarita stuff ready.", "Monica: All right, he's keys are in the drawer. Y'know what? I also need some cash.", 'Rachel: Okay, you want me to stop at the ATM?', "Monica: Nah, while you're at Ross's if you see any lying around", 'Rachel: What?!', "Monica: What?! I-I-I don't, I don't do that!", "[Scene: Gary's cop car, Ross is in the front seat with Gary of course. Chandler is in the back seat.]", 'Ross: (to Gary) That was so cool man, the way you leaned on that guy.']

chandler_dialogue: (laughing) Okay. (Deadpan) But it is officially nighttime.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: (to Gary) He told you everything! I mean you totally cracked him!', "Gary: Yeah well, being that he was the victim, they're usually pretty talkative."]

chandler_dialogue: Your tax dollars?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Oh hey, Gary, want me to grab the berry for ya?', "Gary: It's called the cherry.", "Ross: It's theChandler!!", 'Joey: (returning from a deli) Okay, I got it! This place makes the best sandwich in the world!', 'Gary: Hey Joe does it have meatballs on it?', 'Joey: Oh-ho, yeah!', 'Gary: Does it have melted cheese and marinara sauce?', 'Joey: Yep!', "Gary: Yeah, you can't eat that in my car.", 'Joey: (dejected) Yeah okay. (To Chandler) Even though my tax dollars paid for this car.']

chandler_dialogue: (leans in and takes a sniff of Joey's sandwich) Wow! That sandwich really does smell good.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Yeah, okay.']

chandler_dialogue: I can't smell your sandwich?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Did I say you could smell it?!']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, I'll give them back. (Exhales strongly through his nose and Joey just glares at him.) Look! What is so great about that sandwich?
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Half the taste is in the smell! You-you're sucking up all the tastiness!"]

chandler_dialogue: Okay.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Okay, imagine the best sex you've ever had."]

chandler_dialogue: Yeah.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Are you thinking about Monica?']

chandler_dialogue: Sur-surprise him? We're not, we're not gonna make anybody mad are we?
intervening_dialogues: ["Rachel: Hey! What's up?!", 'Monica: I need a few more things to make the margaritas. Uhh, I need some salt, some margarita mix, and tequila.', 'Rachel: So all we have is ice?', 'Monica: See if he has ice.', 'Rachel: Okay.', "Emily: (on answering machine) Hello Ross? It's Emily. (Rachel runs back into the room with the tequila.) I know this is out of the blue but uh, I'm getting married tomorrow. Well, maybe I am. I keep thinking about you and I'm wondering if-if we made a mistake giving up so fast. Are you thinking about me? Of course you're not, but if you are, call me tonight. Okay, bye.", 'Rachel: Oh. Oh! (Takes a slug of tequila.)', '[Scene: The ride along.]', 'Ross: So where are we going next?', "Gary: This witness won't return my calls so we're gonna see if we can surprise him coming home."]

chandler_dialogue: How do you figure that?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Come on man! (To Gary) Listen so uh, are you gonna squeeze the perps shoes a little bit before he lawyers up?', "Gary: It's a witness not a perp. And no one talks like that!", 'Ross: Yeah, no one talks like that!', 'Joey: Oh what? Like your Mr. Cop!', "Ross: Hey, I'm more cop than you two!"]

chandler_dialogue: Y'know, when you say partner it doesn't sound cop. It, it sounds gay.
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: Hello! I'm in the front seat, okay? I'm Gary's partner!"]

chandler_dialogue: Look at Officer Ross riding back here with the visitors.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Umm, jealous! (He drops the cherry and it turns on.)', "Gary: Hey, do you mind? We're under cover here.", 'Ross: Yeah, no problem. (Tries to turn it off.)', 'Gary: Ross!', "Ross: Sorry! Sorry! Oh, (He sticks it under his shirt) there! (It's just there flashing through his shirt) Hey Gary, who am I? Phone home!"]

chandler_dialogue: Okay, y'know, we-we're safe right? I mean nothing bad can go down!
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Noo! Oh no! No! God no! He should not get back together with her. I know that! You know that! Even Ross knows that! But that still doesnt give us the right to erase his message!', "Monica: I'm his sister, okay? I love him! I don't want to see him get hurt! Come on! Doesnt that give me the right to control himhelp him?", "Rachel: I don't think he's the one who needs help.", "Monica: No, look, she's obviously unstable, okay? I mean she's thinking about running out on her wedding day. (Rachel slowly turns and glares at her.) (Realizing what she just said.) Okay, fine! But I mean, look at the position she's putting him in! What's he gonna do? Ross is gonna run over there on the wedding day and break up the marriage?! I mean, who would do that?! (Rachel again turns and glares at her in disgust.) Okay, fine, all right, but that's y'know, it's different! Although it did involve a lot of the same people.", 'Rachel: Ugh!', "Monica: Y'know what, this is obviously some kind of twisted joke she's trying to play on him.", "Rachel: Okay, you are crazy! I'm sorry, but she sounded generally upset! I mean, listen! (She hits a button on the machine.)", 'Answering Machine: Your messages have been erased.', 'Rachel: Noooooooo!', "[Scene: The ride along, they're all waiting outside of the witness's house and still in the car in the same places as before.]"]

chandler_dialogue: (deadpan) Oh, hurry up. I want to sign that.
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: No. But that reminds me, (handing back a clipboard) sign this.', 'Ross: What is it?', "Gary: Oh it's nothing, it just says that you can't sue the city if you scrap your knee or y'know, get your head blown off."]

chandler_dialogue: What's going on?
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: Okay, here he comes. What is he doing? What the hell is he doing?!', 'Ross: What? What? What? What is it?', 'Joey: Is everything okay?']

chandler_dialogue: Uh, HELLO!!
intervening_dialogues: ["Gary: Okay, he sees us. Now don't move. Don't look at him.", "Gary: Hey, it's okay. It was just a car backfire. (Joey slowly moves off of Ross.) Hey, look at that! You tried to save your buddy. You see that? You see what he did?", 'Joey: (To Ross) You okay man?', 'Ross: Uh-huh. Thank Joey!']

chandler_dialogue: (pouting) It was a car backfire!
intervening_dialogues: ['[Scene: Central Perk, the guys are returning from the ride along to find Phoebe already there.]', 'Gary: Hey, anybody want to meet a hero?', 'Phoebe: (excited) John Glenn is here?!', 'Gary: No, Joey!', "Ross: Pheebs, we had the most incredible night! Okay, so, we're in the car", 'Gary: Wait! Hold on! (He goes over to Phoebe and gives her a kiss.) (To Phoebe) Hi!', 'Phoebe: Hi!', 'Gary: (To Ross) Okay, go ahead.', "Ross: Okay, okay, so we're in the car. Right? And bang! A shot was fired. And Joey with no regard for his own safety throws himself on me!", 'Phoebe: My God, Joey!']

chandler_dialogue: Who jumps at loud noises!
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: Yeah, but-but he didn't know that!", "Joey: Yeah, I didn't know that.", "Ross: And it could've just as easily have been a bullet.", 'Gary: Hey Joe, you ever think about joining the force? We could use a guy like you.']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah! If the car that backfired had run over you! Y'know what, I think I'll go home before Ross starts rambling about his newfound respect for life. (He gets up and starts for the door.)
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: Wow! I could've died tonight."]

chandler_dialogue: (returning) Oh my God! (Storms out.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: I do have a newfound respect for life.']

chandler_dialogue: Oh, I just went for a walk, around the living room. Whatever
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: (To Phoebe) So you wanna get some dinner?', "Phoebe: Yeah! Sure! Yep! (Gets up) Oh, y'know what? If I heard a shot right now, I'd throw my body on you.", 'Gary: Oh yeah? Well maybe you and I should take a walk through a bad neighborhood.', 'Phoebe: Okay!', 'Gary: All right.', 'Phoebe: Bye!', 'Ross and Joey: Bye!', 'Joey: Cut it out Ross! I hate to have to save your life and kick your ass in the same day!', "[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is pacing as Joey enters.]", 'Joey: Dude! How come you took off?']

chandler_dialogue: No. No I'm just tired. Y'know, from-from the walk.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Is something wrong?']

chandler_dialogue: You dove in front of Ross! Ross!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Okay.']

chandler_dialogue: I do not hate Ross!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: That's what this is about! Oh my God, you hate Ross!"]

chandler_dialogue: What picture?
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Of course you do! I saved him! You're mad at me! It all adds up! You want Ross out of the picture."]

chandler_dialogue: Look I'm very glad that you saved Ross from the car backfire, but y'know, it could've been a bullet and you y'know, you didn't try to save me!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: I don't know, but I don't like what I'm hearing!"]

chandler_dialogue: When it comes down to it, you would risk your life for Ross before you would for me. That's the bottom line.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Ohh, you're upset because you think I chose Ross over you! No! Iknewyou could take care of yourself. Y'know, I mean Ross, he need help. He's not street like us!"]

chandler_dialogue: From a bullet!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Well, no, not exactly! All right, look, I, I wasn't trying to save Ross. Okay? My sandwich was next to Ross. All right? I was, I was trying to save my sandwich."]

chandler_dialogue: Much sense?!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: I know it doesn't make much sense"]

chandler_dialogue: So you risked your life, for a sandwich!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Look Chandler, it was instinct! Okay? I just went for it!']

chandler_dialogue: So you didn't uh, choose Ross before me.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: I know it sounds crazy, but Chandler this is (Goes and picks up the sandwich) the greatest sandwich in the world!']

chandler_dialogue: Really?!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: No! I would never do that! You-you're like my brother!"]

chandler_dialogue: Thanks. (He grabs the sandwich.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Yeah! In fact, to prove how much you mean to me, (He unwraps the sandwich and holds it out for Chandler) here.']

chandler_dialogue: (with his mouthful) Oh-oi-ho, yeah!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: No, eh, oh-oi, easy, it's not a hot dog!", 'Joey: How good is that?']

chandler_dialogue: Hm-hmm. (Goes to take another bite.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: See?']

chandler_dialogue: I thought you were showing me how much you mean to me.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Oh-whoa-hey, dude, what are you doing?!']

chandler_dialogue: Before or after you were shot by your own troops?
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: No. (She heads for the door again.)', 'Ross: (looking at the coffee table where his money was) Hey umm, was-was Monica here?', 'Rachel: Yeah.', 'Ross: Yeah, I want my money back.', 'Rachel: (going out the door) Yeah, uh you-you probably need that for stamps, right?', '[Scene: Central Perk, everyone is there.]', 'Ross: Hey Pheebs, has Gary ever been shot at for real?', "Phoebe: Yes. Once. Yeah, a little. He kinda did it to himself. It's not really a good story.", "Ross: I wonder how I would react under fire, y'know? And not backfire but-but heavy fire, like I was in a war or something.", 'Monica: Man, I would be great in a war! I mean, I really, I think I would make a fantastic military leader. I mean I know I would make General way before any of you guys.']

chandler_dialogue: Yes, if the foxhole was lined with sandwiches.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: I know where Joey would be. He would be down in the foxhole protecting all of us.']

chandler_dialogue: (To Monica) Yeah, see, I can't pull of baby-doll can I?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Yeah, hero sandwiches. (Points at Ross who points back.)', "Phoebe: Well you all know that I'm a pacifist so I'm not interested in war in any way. (Gets up) But y'know what? When the revolution comes, I will have to destroy you all. (Starts to leave.) (To Joey) Not you Joey.", 'Teleplay by: Greg Malins Story by: Scott Silveri Transcribed by: Eric Aasen', '[Scene: Central Perk, Gary, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are there.]', 'Gary: (To Phoebe) Would you like some more coffee, baby-doll?', "Phoebe: I'm fine, thanks."]

chandler_dialogue: Okay.
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: No. I think we learned that from the sugarlips incident. I'm gonna get some tea."]

chandler_dialogue: Hiya doin' pumpkin?
(terrified) Right, because it's fast. Because, it's so fast. It's fast!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: I think that is so great! When are you gonna ask her?', "Gary: Tonight, but don't say anything. Okay?", "Monica: I swear, I promise. I promise. Oh my God, I'm so excited! {And I just can't hide it! I'm about to lose control and I think I like it! Sorry, just couldn't resist it.} All right, listen let me tell you, do not get her flowers. Okay? Because y'know, she cries when they die, and there's the whole funeral", "Gary: (To Phoebe) I'll see you after work sweetie. (Kisses her.)", 'Phoebe: Okay. Bye!', 'Phoebe: So, what movie should we see?', "Monica: (sitting down) Gary's gonna ask you to move in with him!!", 'Phoebe: What?! Really?!', "Monica: He just told me at the counter. He made me promise not to tell, but I couldn't hold it in any longer!", "Phoebe: I can't believe this!"]

chandler_dialogue: Oh! Good for you Pheebs, way to go! (Breathes a sigh of relief)
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Relax! It's Phoebe! Not you!"]

chandler_dialogue: So, what are you gonna do?
intervening_dialogues: ["Phoebe: No, but it is fast. Isn't it?", 'Monica: Ohhhh!', "Phoebe: No, I like him a lot but I don't think I'm ready for this!"]

chandler_dialogue: Me?! Why me?
intervening_dialogues: ["Phoebe: I don't know. I'll just handle itI'll ask you to talk to him!"]

chandler_dialogue: I'll try, but I'm not sure what good it would do, y'know? Because I'm a lot less afraid of commitment than I used to be.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Because you are so afraid of commitment! You talk to him, make him scared like you! Make him aman!']

chandler_dialogue: (To Phoebe, behind Monica's back) Still terrified, I'll take care of it. No problem. (When Monica turns back he smiles and kisses her, when she turns away he nods that he'll do it to Phoebe.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: That is so sweet! (She kisses him and turns to add some sugar to her tea.)']

chandler_dialogue: Hey ladies! What are you in here for? (Laughs at his joke.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Yeah?', "Joey: Hey Ross, wouldn't it be great if we could go two straight hours without dropping it?!", "Ross: Uhh, yeah it would! Let's do it!", 'Joey: Okay!', 'Joey: (catches the ball) Uh-oh.', 'Ross: What?', "Joey: I have to pee. And Rachel's in the bathroom!", "Joey: Man, I didn't think we were gonna make it!", "Ross: I know! (Looks at the ball in his hands.) Don't switch hands, okay?", '[Scene: the 5th Precinct, Gary\'s precinct, Chandler has come to talk to him about commitment. And as he\'s walking through the door he notices a couple of "Ladies of the night" sitting there. (If you know what I mean.)]']

chandler_dialogue: Gary, I'm here to report a crime.
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: Hey Chandler, what are you doing here?']

chandler_dialogue: It is a crime that you and I don't spend more time together.
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: Yeah?']

chandler_dialogue: Well, I heard that you thinking about asking Phoebe to move in with you and I thought maybe, we should have a talk. Man to uh, me.
intervening_dialogues: ["Gary: (laughs, then suddenly serious) What's up?"]

chandler_dialogue: Uh, are you crazy? Are you insane? If you live with Phoebe, you two are gonna be y'know, live-living together!
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: Sure. Okay.']

chandler_dialogue: You mean scared.
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: Yeah, I-I considered that. I just know it would make me happy.']

chandler_dialogue: Scared? Happy?
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: No, I mean happy.']

chandler_dialogue: I am trying to open your eyes, my man! Don't you see, if you lived with Phoebe she's always gonna be there. You're gonna get home, she's there. You go to bed, she's there. You wake up and oh yes, she's there!
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: Chandler, what-what are you doing?']

chandler_dialogue: Were you're parents happy, or something?
intervening_dialogues: ["Gary: I know! I can't wait!"]

chandler_dialogue: Wow, y'know when you say it, it doesn't sound so scary.
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: Listen Chandler, the way I see it is that I was lucky enough to find someone that I really love. I justI wanna be around her as much as I can.']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah, I think I do! Y'know what? You move in with her! You move in with her right now! Maybe I should in with Monica!
intervening_dialogues: ["Gary: So you know what I'm talking about, right?"]

chandler_dialogue: (pause) Yeah, you're right about that.
intervening_dialogues: ["Gary: No, it's too soon for you guys."]

chandler_dialogue: Hi!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: (shocked) What?!', 'Rachel: Oh yeah, I got a cat.', "Monica: I don't want a cat!", "Joey: Oh, don't worry, it's not a cat.", 'Ross: Yeah.', 'Rachel: You guys this cat is nothing like my grandmother\'s cat. I mean, it\'s not sweet, it\'s not cute, I even dragged that little string on the ground, and it just flipped out and scratched the hell out of me. And I swear, I know this sounds crazy, but every time this cat hisses at me I know it\'s saying, "Rachel!"', "Ross: Doesn't sound as crazy as paying a thousand dollars for a cat.", 'Monica: (To Rachel) What?! You paid a thousand dollars for a cat when you owe me 300!!', 'Rachel: Well, I was gonna let you play with it.', '[Scene: Central Perk, Phoebe is drinking coffee as Chandler enters.]']

chandler_dialogue: Yes I did, and I think you should do it.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Hmm, did you talk to Gary about the moving in thing?']

chandler_dialogue: He's a great guy, y'know? And he loves you a lot, you are a very lucky lady.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: What?!']

chandler_dialogue: Im sorry. (Pause) If you ask me, I'd move in with him.
intervening_dialogues: ["Phoebe: You are useless! Freaking out about commitment is the one thing you can do! The one thing! And you can't even do that right! God!"]

chandler_dialogue: Hey Gar!
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Ohh!! God! (Gary enters and she sees him) Ooh! (To Chandler) Get out of here, good for nothing.', 'Gary: Hey Chandler.']

chandler_dialogue: Four hours? You guys have been doing this for four hours?
intervening_dialogues: ['Gary: (disappointed) Oh. Oh-oh-okay, I get it.', "Phoebe: I justI don't want us to jump into something we're not ready for.", 'Gary: (disappointed more) Uh-huh.', "Phoebe: I really don't want to mess up what we have. I'm justI'm worried it's gonna be a big mistake.", 'Gary: (on the verge of tears) Yeah.', 'Phoebe: Which is why my answer is yes!', 'Gary: (suddenly happy) Really?!', "Phoebe: Uh-huh! (They hug.) I'm sohappy. (She's not happy.)", "[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Ross, and Monica are still playing catch, with Chandler looking on. Joey throws the ball to Monica who catches it and whips it at Ross.]", "Ross: (catching the ball) Monica! Stop throwing it so hard! We're on the same team!"]

chandler_dialogue: All right, let me in. (He jumps off of the counter to join in the game.)
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: That's right baby."]

chandler_dialogue: What?
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: (jumping in front of him) No-no! Don't do it! Don't!"]

chandler_dialogue: I'm not a dropper!
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: He's a dropper!", "Joey: Oh yeah, that's right!"]

chandler_dialogue: It's throwing and catching!
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: It's really a uh-uh three person game, y'know?"]

chandler_dialogue: Oh! Oh! That's so hard. (Starts to juggle the ball, but loses control and almost drops it and hands it to Monica.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: All right. (He gently tosses the ball to Chandler who catches it.)']

chandler_dialogue: Maybe that's because she's a minion of the anti-Christ.

chandler_dialogue: Y'know, how did I get this reputation as a dropper? Okay? I'm anything but a dropper. chandler_dialogue: Yeah, I know that means buddy!

intervening_dialogues: ['All: Why?!']

chandler_dialogue: Well, I don't know what mad him so mad, y'know? All I said was that uh, I didn't think this wasn't gonna be his big break, that this movie wasn't going to do anything for him, and that uh, y'know it didn't sound like a real movie--Okay, he should've pushed me off of the bridge.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: That game should not be played without my supervision.']

chandler_dialogue: Oh, I figured you guys would all be mad at me. So I got you some gifts that I found on the side of the road. (Looks into the bag.) Who wants the teddy bear with one leg?
intervening_dialogues: ["Phoebe: What's in the bag?"]

chandler_dialogue: (who has just entered) Is that Joey? Is that Joey? Let me talk to him! I wanna talk to him!

intervening_dialogues: ["Phoebe: Okay Joey? Chandler's here, he was wondering (We hear the dial tone as Joey hangs up.) Okay, I guess he ran out of change."]

intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Well, maybe you should send him something. So that when he gets to Las Vegas he'll know that you're sorry."]

(Pause) Im so drunk.', '[Scene: The casino floor, Chandler and Monica are walking through it.]', 'Monica: So, what do you think we should do?']

chandler_dialogue: So where are we on the whole going back to the place where they have all the marriages thing? I love you.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: I know I love you! (They hug.)']

chandler_dialogue: Yes, we dont get married unless theres a sign! Okay, so say uh, say you roll another eight (motions to the craps table) then theres a definite sign that we should get married.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Thats a good question. Look umm, last night we let the dice decide. Maybe we should leave it up to fate again. I love you!']

chandler_dialogue: Sounds great.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: All right, eight we get married, but 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12 we dont get married.']

chandler_dialogue: Ready!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Okay. (They approach the craps table.)', 'Croupler: Coming in, we got a shooter! Money please.', 'Monica: Ready?']

chandler_dialogue: (deadpan) Yes, yes eight.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: (sarcastic) Come on eight.']

chandler_dialogue: That was so unlikely. Well, lets get married! I guess.
intervening_dialogues: ['Croupler: Eight! Easy eight. (She rolls a 3 and a 5 and theyre stunned.)', 'Monica: Wow! I cant believe I actually rolled an eight.']

chandler_dialogue: Thats right! It was the wrong kind of eight, no wedding! Damnit!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Wait a minute. That wasnt a hard eight! Last night I rolled a hard eight.']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah. (They go pack.) Were doing the right thing, right?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: I wanted it so bad! (Pause) Wanna go pack?']

chandler_dialogue: Well you did pull his hair.

I-I am not gonna be that guy!', 'Rachel: What-wh-what so well just stay married forever?!', 'Ross: Okay, look, how is this gonna affect you? Really? I mean you fill some form out once and a while and instead of checking the box that says Ms you check the box that says Mrs.! Its right next to it!', 'Rachel: Ohh, okay, Im sorry. Youre right. Yknow what? We absolutely can stay married, because I was under the impression that the boxes were far away from each other. chandler_dialogue: No!

Well, what if all my stuff was here?

chandler_dialogue: Okay. What if we lived together and you understand what Im saying?

chandler_dialogue: Oh, thats cool. Then Ill just bring them both over.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Well, its a set and they should probably stay together.']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, I get it. So, I get nothing! Nothing here is mine! Everything here is yours! Ill get up in the morning put on your clothes, and head off to work!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: See now-now youre taking them away from their home.']

chandler_dialogue: In the game room!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Yeah-yeah, yknow what? Yeah, thats it-thats it, everything will be mine! Nothing will be yours! Thats-thats what I said! Oh come on, Chandler! Im talking about the barca lounger! It just, it doesnt match! Where is it gonna go?!']

chandler_dialogue: All right! Thats fine! Thats fine! I wont bring over the chairs! I wont bring anything over! I wouldnt want to ruin the ambiance over here at Grandmas place!! (Storms out.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Look it is not my fault that your chairs are incredibly ugly!']

chandler_dialogue: (entering) You can call off the roommate search! (To the potential roommate) Hi! Ill be living here. (Heads for the bathroom.)
intervening_dialogues: ["[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is interviewing a potential roommate. And yes, shes a female, non-smoker and very non-ugly.]", 'Joey: (exiting from Chandlers room with the new roommate) Everything on your application looks really goodOhh! Just one last question umm, are you and your friends gonna be over here all the time like partying and hanging out?', 'The Potential Roommate: Oh dont worry, Im not really a party girl.', 'Joey: Whoa!! Now look, dont be just blurtin stuff out. I want you to really think about your answers. Okay?']

chandler_dialogue: Why did you take the shower curtain down?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Oh dont listen to him, hes just some guy who really wants the apartment, but I dont think hes gonna get it.']

chandler_dialogue: Well, why dont you tell her to stop being silly! (Monica mocks him and he joins in.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Oh thanks, but listen, I was just at Monicas and she and Chandler had a big fight and theyre not moving in.', 'Ross: What do you mean, theyre not moving in? They-theyre still moving in right?', 'Rachel: No-no, they just had a big blowout over what to do with my room.', 'Ross: What?! Over a stupid room!', 'Rachel: Yeah, I feel kinda bad for them, but Im also really psyched cause I dont have to move in here!', 'Ross: Oh no, yeah no, that parts great!', "[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering, dragging Chandler, to mediate the argument between Chandler and Monica.]", 'Ross: Whats all this about you guys fighting?! Is this really over a room?! I mean, that is so silly!', 'Monica: Ross, we can handle this.', 'Ross: Well, apparently not, and I cant just stand by and watch two people I care about very much be hurt over something that is so silly. I mean, enough of the silliness!']

chandler_dialogue: Well, we are fond of the silliness, but we also have a soft spot for the love.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: (stopping them) Okay-okay! Two very good points, look Ive known you both a long time, and Ive never seen either of you one/millionth as happy as youve been since youve got together. Do you really want to throw that all away over a room? That is so silly. Now wh-what is more important, love or silliness?']

chandler_dialogue: Thats laughter.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Love is the best medicine.']

chandler_dialogue: I dont know.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Why do you do it?']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah, I do.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Okay! All right! Now, Chandler you-you wanna live with Monica, right?']

chandler_dialogue: Hes being silly, because he knows that we enjoy the silliness!
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Good! Me neither! So its not a problem. Were just two friends who happen to be roommates.', 'Rachel: Okay, but Ross, eventually you and I are gonna be dating.', 'Ross: Really?! We are?', 'Rachel: Yeah! Im gonna have a boyfriend, youre gonna have a girlfriend', 'Ross: Ohh! That would be great.', 'Rachel: But yknow what, if you think its gonna be okay well just work out a system. Yknow, itll be like college, Ill hang a hanger on the door and put a sign, "Come back later, Im gettin lucky." (Laughs.)', 'Ross: (laughs as well, but for a different reason) Yeah, I didnt think of that.', "[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is once again being dragged in by Ross so he that he can try to manipulate the situation so that its best for Ross, not necessarily whats best for Monica and Chandler.]", 'Ross: So are you sure about this whole moving in thing?! I mean its a really big step! And-and whats the rush?!', 'Monica: Thats very funny!']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah, I'm not so worried.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: No, I-I-Im serious, okay? I mean, think about it. You move in, you start fighting over stupid game rooms, next thing yknow you break up!', 'Monica: Ross, you were right before, it was just a stupid fight about a room.', 'Ross: Okay, there are no stupid fights!! This isnt about the room, this is about what the roomrepresents! And unfortunately, this room (Points to Rachels room) could destroy you!!']

chandler_dialogue: Of course!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Yeah, no, me neither.', 'Ross: Fine! Its your life! (Starts to storm out mad about his failed attempt at the manipulation of his best friend and sister, but stops and tries one last time.) I just dont want to see you guys break up! Which you will do if you move in together, (Monica and Chandler just stare at him.) but thats what you want, theres nothing I can do. (Opens the door and tries one more time.) DONT DO IT!!!!! (Finally leaves.)', 'Monica: You still want to move in together right?']

chandler_dialogue: Scared me out of ever wanting to live with him.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Ross didnt scare you?']

chandler_dialogue: Okay!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Come here, I want to show you something!']

chandler_dialogue: Oh my God! Someones killed Square Man!
Oh thats so sweet! I want to show you something too!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: This is where I thought the barca lounger could go! You see you could see the TV and its still walking distance to the kitchen.']

chandler_dialogue: Yknow those big-big uh, road signs that say "Merge?"
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Okay!']

chandler_dialogue: Yknow? So I was thinking that we could get one of those signs and hang it over our bed. Because, thats you and I together! Merge!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Uh-hmm.']

chandler_dialogue: Really?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Oh my God! I love that!']

chandler_dialogue: Hey!
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Well, who wouldnt?!', 'Ross: I know! Anyway, they asked me to be a guest lecturer! I mean its temporary, but uh, if they like me it could lead to a full time job. How great would that look great on a mailbox, huh? "Professor Geller."', 'Phoebe: Yeah, Professor and Mrs.', 'Rachel: And Mrs.?!', 'Phoebe: Oh! Yeah, yknow you and Ross are still married.', 'Rachel: What?!!', 'Phoebe: Just kidding!', 'Rachel: Ohh! Oh God! (Laughs her way into the living room.)', 'Phoebe: (To Ross) Saved your ass.', '[Scene: Central Perk, Joey, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler are all there as Phoebe enters dejectedly.]']

chandler_dialogue: Oh, whats the matter?
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Hi.', 'Monica: Hey!']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah?
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Well, you know that psychic I see?']

chandler_dialogue: What?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Well, she told me that Im gonna die this week, so Im kinda bummed about that.']

chandler_dialogue: Just out of curiosity did she tell you how youre gonna go?
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Yeah, and I know you guys dont know a lot about psychic readings, but that one is pretty much the worse one you can get.', 'Monica: Phoebe thats crazy!', 'Joey: I cant believe she would say that too you.', 'Rachel: Yeah honey you dont believe her do you?', 'Phoebe: I dontshe said yknow that Id have triplets! But she also said one of them would be black.']

chandler_dialogue: Oh hi!
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: No, cause she didnt tell me I was gonna die until the very end of the session, and I was not gonna waste a whole another hour there! I mean Ive only got a week left, yknow? Ive really gotta start living now! (So she picks up the latest copy of Car and Driver (a U.S. auto magazine), leans back, and starts reading.)', 'Ross: (entering) Hey everyone!']

chandler_dialogue: Why dont you open with a joke?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Hey uh, well, todays my first lecture and I kinda wanted to try it out on you guys, do you, do you mind?', 'All: Oh thatd be great. Sure!', 'Ross: (he starts reading directly from his cards word for word very quietly) "There are three primary theories concerning sediment flow rate. Each of these theories can be further subcategorized into two distinct"', 'Phoebe: Oh, this is it. This whats gonna kill me.', 'Ross: (continuing) "subcategories. The first of these subcategories is"', 'Joey: (interrupting him) Uh Ross! Are there uh, are there naked chicks on that piece of paper?', 'Ross: No! Why?', 'Joey: Well, Ive just never seen a guy stare so hard at a piece of paper that didnt have naked chicks on it.', 'Ross: Ohh! Okay! Okay. (Resumes reading word for word from the card) "There are three (pauses and looks at Joey) primary theories concerning sediment flow rate. (Pauses and darts his eyes between Chandler and Rachel.) (Rachel starts laughing) Each of these theories (glances at Phoebe) can be further subcategorized (glances at Chandler) into"']

chandler_dialogue: Wait a minute, hold the phone! Youre not talking about Chuckles University?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Open with a joke? Its a university, not a comedy club!']

chandler_dialogue: Thats the way I did it til I was 19.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: (gets up) Okay!', 'All: Ohh! Were kidding! Oh, were kidding!', 'Rachel: Ross, hey you know what might make it less boring?', 'Ross: Thank you!', 'Rachel: Some uh, some visual aides.', 'Joey: Oh-ooh-ooh! Yknow whats a good visual aide?', 'Ross: Please dont say naked chicks.', 'Joey: Why not?!', 'Ross: I-I-I dont even know why I bother to talk to you guys about it. Yknow what? Im just gonna do it on my own with no naked chicks.']

chandler_dialogue: Hey.
intervening_dialogues: ["[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is playing that string game with the two hands and the weird crossing patterns as Chandler enters with the mail.]"]

chandler_dialogue: Yes, you got something from the Screen Actors Guild.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Hey! Any good mail?']

chandler_dialogue: (opens and reads it) "Benefits lapsed."
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Ooh, its probably a residual check, hey can you open it for me, Im kinda.']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, its not a check. Theyre saying your health insurance expired because, you didnt work enough last year.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Hmm thats weird. I dont remember being in a move called benefits lapsed.']

chandler_dialogue: All right.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Let me see that!']

chandler_dialogue: Im sorry man, theres never a good time to (pauses) stop catching on fire.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: (reads it) Oh, I cant believe this! This sucks! When I had insurance I could get hit by a bus or catch on fire, yknow? And it wouldnt matter. Now I gotta be careful?!']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, make sure you look both ways before you cross the street.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: All right well, I guess I gotta go get a job. Im gonna go see my agent.']

chandler_dialogue: Hey!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: What are you talkin about? I never left you! Youve always been my agent!', 'Estelle: Really?!', 'Joey: Yeah!', 'Estelle: Oh well, no harm, no foul.', 'Joey: Estelle, you gotta get me some work. I-I lost my health insurance.', 'Estelle: All right, first thing we gotta do, damage control.', 'Joey: Why?', 'Estelle: Well, I think uhh, someone out there may have been bad mouthing you all over town.', 'Joey: Bastard!', "[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler enters to find Joey lying in the fetus position on the floor.]"]

chandler_dialogue: Thats great, but shouldnt you be on the toilet right now?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: (in obvious pain) Hey! So Estelle lined up a bunch of auditions for me tomorrow and Ill have my health insurance back in no time.']

chandler_dialogue: Whats wrong with you?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: What?!']

chandler_dialogue: This sounds like a hernia. You have toyou-you go to the doctor!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Nothing! Well, I-I got this blinding pain in my stomach when I was lifting weights before, then I uh passed out and uh, havent been able to stand up since. But um, I dont think its anything serious.']

chandler_dialogue: Thats a hernia.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: No way! Kay look, if I have to go to the doctor for anything its gonna be for this thing sticking out of my stomach! (Rolls over and shows Chandler.)']

chandler_dialogue: Hey, will you grab me a cruller? (Joey starts to groan and get up.) Sit down! Will you go to the hospital?!
intervening_dialogues: ['The Professor: Dr. Geller, Kurt Rathman, Im a professor in the paleontology department here.', 'Ross: Oh.', 'The Professor: Do you have a moment to talk about your lecture?', 'Ross: (in his British accent) Im sorry, Ive got plans with my sister.', 'Monica: (in an Irish accent) Monica Gellerrr. (She rolls her R)', 'Ross: (in accent) Right, will you excuse us for one moment? (Takes Monica aside.) (In his normal voice.) What are you doing?', 'Monica: (normal voice) Oh, you can have an accent and I cant?! (To an exiting student in accent.) Top O the morning to ya laddies!', 'Ross: Just please stop!', 'Rachel: (in an Indian accent) Yes, yes, Bombay is bery, bery nice time of year.', '[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is reading on the couch while Joey, still suffering from his hernia, is returning with coffee for them both. After a series of grunts and groans he manages to painfully walk back from the counter, sit down, and slide Chandler his coffee.]']

chandler_dialogue: I will loan you the money. Just go to the hospital and lets just get that thingpushed back in.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Dude! Hernia operations cost like, a lot probably. Besides its getting darker and more painful, that means its healing.']

chandler_dialogue: Hey.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Thank you, but it would take me forever to pay you that money back and I dont want that hanging over my head. Okay? Besides, as soon as my insurance kicks in I can get all the free operations I want! Yeah, Im thinking Ill probably start with that laser eye surgery too.', 'Phoebe: Hey!']

chandler_dialogue: Oh Joeys got a really bad hernia, but thats nothing a little laser eye surgery wont fix!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Hey!', 'Phoebe: Whats going on?']

chandler_dialogue: Listen, Im really glad you got the part.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Yes!', 'Rachel: Okay! (Picks up the phone and starts dialing.) (In an Irish accent) "Hello Ross, this is Dr. McNeeley from the Fake Accent University, wed like you to come on board with us full time! (Hangs up.)', 'Phoebe: (entering) Hey!', 'Rachel: Hey!', 'Phoebe: Listen to this! My reading was wrong, Im not going die!', 'Rachel: Really?! How do you know?', 'Phoebe: Because my psychic is dead! She mustve read the cards wrong!', 'Rachel: Oh, Im sorry.', 'Phoebe: Eh, better her than me! Hey, lets bake cookies!', '[Scene: Silvercup Studios, Joey has won the part of dying man and is now able to play the role he was injured for. Chandler is helping to carry him in.]']

chandler_dialogue: But are you sure you can do this?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: (barely audible through the pain) Thank you.']

chandler_dialogue: Now, is that never talking about it again?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Yeah! And hey, thanks for coming with me. And thanks again for helping me take a shower.']

chandler_dialogue: Im sorry! Hey-hey Joe, why dont you uh, lift up your shirt? (He does.) Take a look at this kiddo. (Alex finally starts crying.) We have a crying child! Roll the damn cameras!
intervening_dialogues: ['The Director: All right, from the top.', 'A Crew Member: Scene 5, take 2.', 'A Crew Member: Take 36 is up!', 'The Director: All right! Lets try this again! You ready Joe?', 'Joey: Ah, just one thing umm, is it all right with you if I, if I scream right up until you say action?', 'The Director: Uh sure.', 'Joey: Okay. (Starts screaming.)', 'The Director: Action!', 'Joey: (he stops screaming at action) "Take good care of your Momma son." (Again Alex does nothing.)', 'The Director: Cut!!!!!!!!!! (Joey starts screaming again.)']

chandler_dialogue: What are you doing?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: (in his head) All right, keep going. We are phasing the accent out, phasing it out. So without out re-testing the results in the laboratory (pronounced the British way) the team would never have identified (British) the initial errors in their carbon dating analysis (British). Were there any questions at this point? (One student raises his hand.) Yes. (Points to him.)', 'A Student: Whats happening to your accent?', 'Ross: (British) Come again? Whats-whats this nonsense? (Giggles.) (American.) All right, Im-Im not English. Im from Long Island. I was really nervous and the accent just uh, just came out. Im sorry. So, if we could just get back to the lecture. Umm, were there any questions? (Everyone raises their hands) About paleontology. (They all put their hands down.) All right, look I was just trying to make a good first impression. Obviously, I screwed up. But what you guys think of me is really important because Im-Im hoping to get a permanent job here. So if you just give me another chance to make a good impression', 'Rachel: Ross!! Are you crazy?! I am still your wife!! What, were you just never gonna tell me?!! What the hell is wrong with you?!!!! Ugh, I could just kill you!!!!', 'Ross: (in the accent again) Well, hello Rachel!', "[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is holding a football helmet; and apparently, in a rather disgusting scene, Joey wants Phoebe to beat him senseless. (Luckily it isnt a long trip.) Because hes made a miraculous recovery from his hernia and wants to take advantage of all those free surgeries he can get now since hes re-established his health insurance.]", 'Phoebe: Have you really done this before?', 'Joey: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! You just take a big, big swing. Now, dont hold back. (He dons his protective helmet (Why, I have no clue.) and Phoebe picks up a wooden baseball bat and starts to swing as Chandler and Monica enter.)', 'Phoebe: Hey!', 'Joey: Hey-hey-hey!']

chandler_dialogue: Oh, all right.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Were just celebrating that Joey got his health insurance back.']

chandler_dialogue: What?
intervening_dialogues: ['Written by: Perry Rein & Gigi McCreery Transcribed by: Eric Aasen', "[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is there except for Rachel and Ross, who both come storming in. Rachel is still going off about Rosss secret marriage.]", 'Rachel: I cannot believe that you didnt tell me that we are still married!!', 'Ross: Look I was going to tell you!', 'Rachel: When?! After the birth of our first secret child?! (To All) Ross didnt get the annulment; we are still married.']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, let me just jump in and ask, at what point did you think this was a successful marriage?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Youre kidding!', 'Phoebe: (overdoing it) Oh my God!!', 'Monica: Ross!', 'Ross: Okay, maybe it wasnt my best decision. But I just couldnt face another failed marriage.']

chandler_dialogue: Ross, just for my own piece of mind, youre not married to anymore of us are ya?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Rach, come on, if you think about it, its actually kinda funny. (He laughs, and he laughs alone.) Okay, maybe its best not to think about it.', 'Phoebe: Okay, this is inexcusable. I am shocked to my very core!', 'Ross: Phoebe, I told her you already knew.', 'Phoebe: Another lie. You have a sickness!']

chandler_dialogue: You left a shoe here?!
intervening_dialogues: ['[Scene: Central Perk, Joey and Monica are at the counter getting some more coffee.]', 'Joey: Oh! Hey, somebody left their keys. (Looks at them) Ooohh, to a Porsche! {Transcribers note: Oh come on! Who would leave the keys to their Porsche behind? If I had a Porsche, Id have the keys surgically attached to my hand!} Hey Gunther, these yours?', 'Gunther: Yeah, thats what I drive. I make four bucks an hour, I saved up for 350 years!', 'Joey: Na-uh! (To everyone there) Hey did anybody lose their keys?', 'Monica: Joey, why dont you put them in the lost and found?', 'Joey: Theres a lost and found? (Gunther sets the box up on the table.) My shoe! (Grabs it out of the box.)']

chandler_dialogue: Oh good, when he comes back for his keys, Ill be sure to give him your shoe.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Well, I didnt realize until I got home. I wasnt gonna walk all the way back down here with one shoe! Yknow what? Im gonna go find that guys car and leave a note on the windshield. (Goes to do so.)']

chandler_dialogue: (not enthused) Yeah, all right.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Great! Thanks. (Exits.)', 'Phoebe: (coming in from the bathroom) Oh, good, good, you guys are here! Listen, how would like to spend tomorrow taking care of three incredibly cute little puppies?!', 'Monica: Oh my God, what a fun day! That sounds great!']

chandler_dialogue: Whoa-whoa-whoa! What?
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Okay, well Ill bring them by tomorrow morning. Okay, and uh, by the way, theyre not actually puppies, theyre Frank and Alices triplets. Okay, see ya! (Exits.)']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah, Im gonna pass. Cause I was kinda iffy when it was puppies.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: (stops) Please! Please! Please! Please! Oh please! Please! Please! Frank and Alice asked me to baby sit the triplets and Im nervous cause Ive never done that before by myself!', 'Monica: Dont worry about it Phoebe, well absolutely do it.']

chandler_dialogue: Little baby girl Chandler, where I have heard that before? Oh right, Coach Ruben. (Tries to get her to drink a little more from the bottle when he suddenly smells something. Its times like these Im glad Smell-O-Vision hasnt been invented.) Do you know what Pheebs? When youre done over there, we kinda have a situation over here too. (Phoebe is changing hers.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Look I told you', 'Rachel: I dont wanna hear "Three failed marriages!"', 'Ross: Look, if youd had two failed marriages, youd understand!', 'Rachel: Well, yknow what? Thanks to you Im half way there! Ugh! Oh! I am so mad! Ross, I dont think I have ever been this angry!', 'Ross: What about the time I said we were on a break?', 'Rachel: Ugh! (Stares at him.)', "[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next day, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are baby-sitting the triplets. They each have one baby.]", 'Monica: Pheebs, hows it going?', 'Phoebe: (rapidly) Im doing okay. I think its going well. Do you think theyre having fun? Am I talking to fast?', 'Monica: Nope, sound like me. Pheebs, its going great. Look at Chandler with little baby girl Chandler.']

chandler_dialogue: See thats where I think that youre wrong. Weve been playing these babies man for man; we should really be playing a zone defense.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Na-uh, no, we are all responsible for our own babies.']

chandler_dialogue: I just think that things would go a lot smoother if we each have our own zone. Phoebe, you can be in charge of wiping. And yknow Mon, you can be in charge of diapering and I can be in charge of looking how cute they are when they put their hands around (He degrades into baby talk, but he means when they grab his finger.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: What do you mean?']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, Im a rookie. I should not be in the end zone.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: That sounds really great, but maybe you should be in charge of wiping.']

chandler_dialogue: Hey!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: This is so great! This is exactly how we set the plates at the restaurant.', 'Phoebe: Yeah? (Checking the final diaper) Well this is not what I ordered.', 'Joey: (entering) Hey guys!']

chandler_dialogue: Shocking! Since you still have the keys.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Hey!', 'Joey: Hey babies! Oh, Im having the best morning. That uh, that Porsche Ive got the keys too, still there!']

chandler_dialogue: What equity investments?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: You should see the treatment I get when Im with that car! People are friendly; they-they wanna talk, and not just about the car! One guy gave me advice about my equity investments.']

chandler_dialogue: You dont even have a car!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: The ones that got me the Porsche! Will you keep up! (Chandler wipes his forehead with a baby wipe, that might have been used. He drops it disgustedly.) But I figured, if-if people keep seeing me just standing there, theyre gonna start to think that I dont own it. So I figured Ill wash it. Right? Monica, you got a bucket and some soap I can borrow?', 'Monica: Oh yeah, I got soap and sponges and rags and Carnuba wax and polishing compound.']

chandler_dialogue: And?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: I know. But umm, one time there was this really dirty car in front of the building, so I washed it.']

chandler_dialogue: There you are.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: And six others.']

chandler_dialogue: (entering) Check it out! Check it out! When the babies wake up, they can meet Krog! (He holds up this Xena-like warrior action figure.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Yeah, but its my wax.', 'The Porsche Owner: Listen, I-I-I dont come to this city much so I dont know if youre crazy or this is some kind of street theater, but could I have my keys.', 'Joey: Sure. Here. (He hands them over.) Ill uh, save your parking spot.', 'The Porsche Owner: Im not coming back.', 'Joey: Why not?', 'The Porsche Owner: I live upstate.', 'Joey: Yeah, so did I.', "[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the triplets are all in their crib as Monica and Phoebe watch them.]", 'Phoebe: I dont know why I was so nervous about this. And I dont know why Frank and Alice are always complaining. This is so easy.', 'Monica: Yeah, two hours, a lifetime thats the same.']

chandler_dialogue: He can do more than that! He can destroy the universe!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Chandler, what are you doing? That thing can put someones eye out!']

chandler_dialogue: Theyre not gonna swallow anything, you guys are being way over protective. When I was a kid, my mom used to just throw me into a pile of broken glass!
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: No Chandler, they can swallow one of those little parts! And also, look at his smooth area, thats just gonna mess them up.']

chandler_dialogue: Glass, sand, whatever. (Walks out as Monica and Phoebe turn to check on the babies again.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: What?!']

chandler_dialogue: (entering) All right. (Clears throat) I thought about it and maybe youre right. Maybe Krog is not a safe toy.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Oh, look at little Leslie stretching in her sleep.', 'Monica: Oh its so cute. I wonder what age it is when you stop being able to put both legs over your head.', 'Phoebe: Oh, I can still do that.', 'Monica: How are you still single?!']

chandler_dialogue: I swallowed the sonic blaster gun.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Good. What made you change your mind?']

chandler_dialogue: Thanks.

chandler_dialogue: Look, it really is gonna be okay. The important thing is that we love each other and that were gonna get married.

(She starts to cry, as does Monica.)']

chandler_dialogue: Well, I have some.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Do you even understand what off the rack means?!', 'Phoebe: Look, why dont you just pay for it yourself?', 'Monica: How? I dont have any money.']

chandler_dialogue: No, I realize that honey, but Im not gonna spend all of the money on one party.

chandler_dialogue: Ehh.

intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Eh, you work for that.']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah, Im putting my foot down. Yeah look, when I proposed I told you that I would do anything to make you happy, and if having the perfect wedding makes you happy then, then thats what were gonna do.

Of course, wed have an apartment over the garage where Joey could grow old.

chandler_dialogue: Sure you do.

intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Uh-hmm.']

intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: My dad wanted to know if you wanted to play racquetball with us.', 'Monica: Wow! Thats great! Dad must really like you, he doesnt ask just anyone to play.', 'Ross: Yeah and he didnt really ask for you, he asked for Chancy, I assumed he meant you.']

chandler_dialogue: Oh no problem, maybe Ill play with my left hand.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: No, I-I thought it would be more fun this way.', 'Monica: This is so cool, maybe this is something you can do every week.', 'Ross: Or you can sit with him on the front porch and make sure no one steals the trash cans. intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: No one got me an engagement present.', 'Phoebe: Okay, here I wish you health and happiness. (She hands Monica a cookie in a plastic baggie.)']

chandler_dialogue: We cant accept this.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: (To Chandler) This is what happens when you dont register for gifts!', 'Phoebe: See no-no, I made a batch and I froze it, and this is the only one left.']

intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Why not?']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, we owe you a present.

intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: That and arrogance.', 'Joey: (entering) Hey.', 'Monica: Hey! How was sailing?', 'Joey: I dont want to talk about it. (He grabs whats left of the cookie and pops in his mouth.)', 'Monica and Phoebe: No-wait-no-no!!!!!!!', 'Joey: (recoils in horror) Women are mean!!! (Storms out.)', 'Phoebe: I cant believe that! Now the only thing left of my grandmothers legacy is this crumb. (She picks it up with her finger and holds it out to Monica.) I wish you a long and happy marriage.', 'Ross: (entering with Chandler) Hey.', 'Monica: Hey! How was it?', 'Ross: Well I had a great time! Umm, Chancy on the other hand']

chandler_dialogue: Daddy. All right look, heres the story. (Flashback to Chandler about to enter the steam room as he does the voice-over.) Well, we had just finished playing racquetball and we were gonna take a steam. I walk into the steam room and it was really steamy. (The flashback shows his glasses fog up and him trying to find his way around the steam filled room. He takes off his glasses.) So I take off my glasses and thats when in happened.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: And what did he ask you not to call him?']

chandler_dialogue: Guys?
I know.

(Chandler quickly jumps off and sits next to him with a shocked expression on his face.)', "[Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is finished telling everyone what happened.]", 'Monica: Oh my God Chandler! I cant believe it!']

chandler_dialogue: Why do they put so much steam in there?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: You gave my father a lap dance!']

intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Cause otherwise theyd have to call it the room room.']

chandler_dialogue: Not that big a deal? Therethere was touching of things.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Come on, its not that big a deal!']

chandler_dialogue: I dont want him to tell this story for years.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Now, I know you wanted to bond with my dad, but did you really have to bond to that part?', 'Monica: Listen, Im sure that dad doesnt care. He probably thought this was funny; hell be telling this story for years!']

intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Oh, but he will. He still tells the story how Monica tried to escape from fat camp.', 'Monica: I wasnt escaping.', 'Ross: Then how did you get caught in the barbed wire?', 'Monica: I was trying to help out a squirrel.', 'Ross: You were trying to eat it!']

chandler_dialogue: (getting up) All right, Im off to see your dad.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: (takes the phone from Ross) Come on. (Answering phone) Hello? (Listens) Im sorry you have the wrong number. (Listens) (Whispering) Okay, Ill call you later dad. I love you. (Hangs up.)', '[Scene: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, and Rachel are there.]']

chandler_dialogue: Look, I figured I would try to convince him not to tell the story anymore, and I figure the best way to do that is face to faceAnd by face I dont mean his lap. And by face, I dont mean my ass. (Exits.)

(Tosses her the bag.)', 'Phoebe: (reading the recipe on the back of the bag) Yes!! (Realizes.) Ohh.', 'Monica: I cannot believe that I just spent the last two days trying to figure out the recipe and it was in my cupboard the whole time!', 'Phoebe: I know! You see it is stuff like this which is why (Looking down) youre burning in hell!!', '[Scene: The Gym, Chandler and Mr. Geller are heading for the whirlpool room.]']

chandler_dialogue: What did you do when they found out?
intervening_dialogues: ['Mr. Geller: I understand completely, theres nothing more horrifying than embarrassing yourself in front of your in-laws. As a matter of fact, when I started dating Judy I was unemployed, and her father asked me what I did for a living and I told him I was a lawyer.']

chandler_dialogue: So I guess we wear swimsuits in here!
intervening_dialogues: ['Mr. Geller: They never did, so if ever see me giving them legal advice just nod along. Shall we?']

chandler_dialogue: Secret? Married people arent supposed to have secrets between one another. We have too much love and respect for one another.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: I cant tell you. Its a secret.']

chandler_dialogue: Oh no-no, I cant do that.

chandler_dialogue: Okay.

chandler_dialogue: So, Ross and I are going to Disneyland and we stop at this restaurant for tacos. And when I say restaurant, I mean a guy, a hibachi, and the trunk of his car. So Ross has about 10 tacos. And anyway, were on Space Mountain and Ross starts to feel a little iffy.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Okay.']

chandler_dialogue: No, he visited a little town south of throw up. (Monica laughs hysterically.) So what was Phoebes secret?

chandler_dialogue: Thats it?! I gave up my Disneyland story for that?

chandler_dialogue: (angrily) Did she call? You-you told her I was sick right? Always tell her I am sick!
