intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Wh-why is that the best part?', 'Monica: Because then I dont have to!', 'Rachel: Well of course we will help you decide! We will do anything we can to help you! Now, I would like to make a toast, to the future Mrs. Chandler Bing (A woman at the table behind them overhears Chandlers name and starts listening closer), my best friend, and truly one of the nicest people that', 'Monica: Im really not deciding!', 'Rachel: Fine!', 'Woman: Excuse me, I-I couldnt help overhearing, youre marrying Chandler Bing?', 'Monica: Yeah thats right.', 'Woman: (sarcastically) Huh, good luck!', 'Phoebe: Aww, and good luck to you too! (To Monica and Rachel) What a nice lady!', "[Scene: Ross's apartment, Chandler, Joey, and Ross are finishing watching Die Hard on video.]"]

chandler_dialogue: Whatd you rent?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Yep. Hey, what do you say we make it a double feature?']

chandler_dialogue: (looking at the tape) Joey, this is Die Hard 1 again.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Die Hard 2.']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah, I just got uh, got plans.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Oh, well we watch it a second time and its Die Hard 2!', 'Ross: Joey, we just saw it!', 'Joey: And?', 'Ross: And itll be cool to see it again! Yeah!', 'Joey and Ross: Die Hard!!!!!!', 'Ross: Dude, you didnt say Die Hard. Is everything okay?']

chandler_dialogue: No, see the thing is I want to get out of here before Joey gets all worked up and starts calling everybody bitch.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Well, John McLane had plans!']

chandler_dialogue: Thats sweet.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Well, I dont know!!', 'Ross: We fell asleep! That is all.', 'Joey: Yeah. Yep. Yeah. All right, well uh, Id better go.', 'Ross: I think that would be best.', 'Joey: Yeah. All right, Ill talk to you later.', 'Ross: Okay. But not about this!', 'Joey: No! Never! Never! (Pause, then Joey wants to shake Rosss hand.) Bye.', 'Ross: No touch! No touch!', "[Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica has just gotten back from brunch and is telling Chandler about it.]", 'Monica: Yeah hey, a weird thing happened today whey I was at brunch. This woman overheard that I was marrying you and-and then sheshe wished me good luck.']

chandler_dialogue: So uh, what did this woman look like?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: No, its more like a (sarcastically) good luck.']

chandler_dialogue: Well, is there any chance you were looking into a bright, shiny thing called a mirror?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: She was like 30, dark hair, attractive.']

chandler_dialogue: No, no I only dated two girls in college, both blonde, both not attractive (Thinks a little while.) Hold on one second; let me check this out. (He gets up and grabs a photo album.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Come on, was it somebody maybe you dated in college?']

chandler_dialogue: Well, lets see (Finding the picture he wants.) Okay uh, is that her? (Pointing to the picture.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: What are you doing?']

chandler_dialogue: Julie Grath, my camp girlfriend.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Oh my God yes! Who is she?']

chandler_dialogue: (pause) No, were still together. Yeah we went out for two summers, and then I broke up with her.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Did you break up with her?']

chandler_dialogue: Well, cause she came back the third summer and shed gotten really fa-aa-aw-ow
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Why?']

chandler_dialogue: I did not say fat! I said, "Fa-aa-aw-ow"
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Fat?!']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah. Yeah, but it was a really, really long time ago! Does she still feel bad?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: You broke up with a girl because she was fat?!']

chandler_dialogue: Well, you know what they say, elephants never forget. (Monica is not amused by that statement.) Seriously, good luck marrying me.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Well, apparently she does.']

chandler_dialogue: Can you figure out what Im doing?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Ive said it! Okay?! But its over Joey!', 'Joey: I want to do it again.', 'Ross: We cant do it again.', 'Joey: Why not?', 'Ross: Because its weird!', 'Joey: Fine! Do you want something to drink?', 'Ross: Sure, what do you got?', 'Joey: Warm milk and Excedrin P.M. (Ross just leaves.)', "[Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is approaching the bathroom door behind which Chandler is using the facility.]", 'Monica: Chandler! (Knocks on the door.) Chandler! I just figured out who you are!']

chandler_dialogue: Who?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Youre Lewis Posin.']

chandler_dialogue: Because you kept talking to him while he was trying to go to the bathroom?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Lewis Posin! He was my best friend in fifth grade, and-and then one day I asked him to be my boyfriend and he said no. Do you know why?']

chandler_dialogue: What? Are you kidding? That was like 16 years ago.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: No! But because he thought I was to faaaaa. (Chandler emerges, without flushing by the way.) And every time I think about it, it makes me feel as bad as I did in fifth grade! Yknow, I-I really think that you should apologize to Julie.']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, I will do it. But I have to warn you; this may make me a better person and that is not the man you feel in love with!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: No, I know. But yknow what? It would make me feel better if Lewis apologized to me.']

chandler_dialogue: (she opens the door) Julie hi! Chandler Bing, I, I guess you remember me.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross and Joey: Oh! Thats nice.', 'Rachel: Thank you. Thank you very much. Umm, Ive known them separately and Ive known them together and-and to know them as a couple is to know that you are truly in the presence of love. So I would like to raise my glass (Grabs a glass and holds it up) to Monica and Chandler and the beautiful adventure they are about to embark upon together. I can think of no two people better prepared for the journey.', 'Joey: Wow. (To Ross) Good speech.', 'Ross: Yeah, it really was!', 'Rachel: Aw, thanks!', 'Ross: Okay Phoebe, I guess youre next (To Joey) although I really dont see the point.', 'Joey: Yeah.', 'Phoebe: Okay, I cant believe that Monica and Chandler are getting married. I remember talking about this day with Rachel while we were showering together, naked. (Raises her glass and drinks.)', 'Joey: And shes back in the game.', '[Scene: A random apartment building, Chandler and Monica are knocking on the door of the woman from the beginning.]']

chandler_dialogue: (To Monica) Its a nickname, Ill explain later.
intervening_dialogues: ['Julie: Hello Skidmark.']

chandler_dialogue: Ah, uh, I owe you a long overdue apology. I never should have broken up with you because you were overweight.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Its pretty clear.']

chandler_dialogue: You-you-you didnt know that. (Pause as she nods no.) Well, I guess my work here is done!
intervening_dialogues: ['Julie: Thats why you broke up with me?']

chandler_dialogue: As bad as that went I actually enjoyed myself. I think that Im going to apologize for all of the stupid things I do.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: No! Yknow what? No! No! You thing was so stupid anyway, this was ridiculousWere gonna flip a coin! (Phoebe gasps.) All right?! (She flips the coin.) Heads! (Looks at the coin and grunts in disgust.)', 'Phoebe: The coins have finally forgiven me!', 'Rachel: Well yknow what? I hope Monica forgives you after you throw her, her vegetarian, voodoo, goddess circley shower! (Runs out.)', 'Phoebe: (running after her) Rach, its gonna be okay! (To Ross and Joey) You guys are the best!', 'Joey: Boy I tell ya, that judging stuff took a lot out of me.', 'Ross: Yeah?', 'Joey: Yeah! I was thinking about maybe going upstairs and taking a little nap on my couch. (Raises his eyebrows, questioning Ross to see if he wants to join him.)', 'Ross: Why-why would I care about that?', 'Joey: No reason, Im just saying that uh Thats where Ill be.', "[Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler and Monica have returned from Julies.]"]

chandler_dialogue: I would really love it if could do both.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Why dont you just stop doing stupid things? Then you wouldnt have to apologize.']

chandler_dialogue: What?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: All right, II have to ask.']

chandler_dialogue: What?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Are you gonna break up with me if I get fat again?']

chandler_dialogue: A hundred and forty-five pounds.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Well, you broke up with Julie Grath! How much weight could she have gained?']

chandler_dialogue: Look I know it was a stupid reason to break up with somebody, but I was 15!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: In one year?! My God what did she eat? Her-her family! Thats not the point.']

chandler_dialogue: Okay. Okay, now wait a minute that was totally different.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Well Thats not the only time this was an issue. You remember when umm, you spent Thanksgiving with us? You called me fat.']

chandler_dialogue: You were not supposed to hear that! I said that behind you back!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: How?']

chandler_dialogue: Look you have to realize I dont think of you as a thin, beautiful woman. (Monica glares at him.) See this is one of things that I can apologize for later! Look, what I mean is youre Monica! Okay? And I am in love with Monica.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: What if I have babies, okay? I mean Im gonna look different. Im okay with that, but Im not sure that you are!']

chandler_dialogue: So you can balloon up or you can shrink down and I will still love you.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Keep going.']

chandler_dialogue: Id carry you around in my pocket.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Even if I shrink down to two inches tall?']

chandler_dialogue: Skidmarks still got a way with the ladies.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: I love you. (They hug and kiss.)']

chandler_dialogue: Come on! Why are we here?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Fine! (Pause) Now, whered we land on those pancakes? (She chases him out the door as his date emerges from the bathroom.)', 'Joeys Date: Hi!', 'Rachel: Hi.', 'Joeys Date: Sorry about that, but I couldnt get that lock to work on the door.', 'Rachel: Yeah, Joey kinda disabled it when I moved in.', 'Joeys Date: You must be Rachel, Im Erin.', 'Rachel: Hi.', 'Erin: Hi. I dont mean this to sound like high school, but did he say anything about me?', 'Rachel: (pause) Would you like some pancakes?', '[Scene: N.Y.Us University Library, Ross is entering with Chandler.]']

chandler_dialogue: The hot chicks?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Okay, okay take a guess.']

chandler_dialogue: Wow thats actually pretty cool.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Okay, okay, I was typing names into the library computer earlier, yknow-yknow for fun, and I typed mine in and guess what came up? My doctoral dissertation! Its here! Yeah, its right-its right down here! In the biggest library in the university! (They start heading that way, towards a secluded section behind the racks.)']

chandler_dialogue: Sounds like two people are really enjoying the Dewey decimal system.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: (stopping quickly) Oh umm, theres also a book here by a woman named Wendy Bagina. (They both laugh, but stop when the hear moaning coming from the next aisle.) What is that?']

chandler_dialogue: You didnt bring me here to do that, did you?
intervening_dialogues: ['Female Student: (as they are moving past Ross) Im so sorry!', 'Male Student: Sorry!']

chandler_dialogue: OHMYGAWD! I am so sorry sweetie, are you okay? You didnt tell her we were getting married, did you?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: She sent the chicken back again?!', 'The Waitress: She says its to dry now and she wants to come back here and explain to you exactly how she wants it.', 'Monica: Well fine! I want to meet this chicken expert! Send the Colonel in!', 'The Colonel: OHMYGAWD!!!! (Yep, its Janice.)', 'Monica: (to the lobster) Lucky bastard! (Throws the lobster in and turns around to face the planets most annoying woman, next to Dr. Laura and Kathy Lee Gifford of course. Shes the most annoying female TV character however.) Janice.', 'Janice: How are you Ms. Hot Shot chef with the big fancy restaurant with the best chicken ever! (Does the laugh.)', 'Monica: Im fine.', 'Janice: (notices Monicas engagement ring) Ohh! What is that on your finger?! Im blind!', 'Monica: Oh Uh', 'Janice: So, whos the lucky guy?']

chandler_dialogue: Did she freak out?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Well, she saw the ring.']

chandler_dialogue: Right.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Well, she was shocked when I told her, but then again so were most people.']

chandler_dialogue: (laughs) You said no right?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Well, she actually has a boyfriend yknow herself, named Clark. Uh, she also kinda invited herself to our wedding. Clark too.']

chandler_dialogue: You said no right?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Huh?']

chandler_dialogue: Lie!!! How hard is that?! The checks in the mail! Oh your baby is so cute! I cant wait to read your book Ross!!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Well, she corned me! She asked if the wedding was in town! I mean, what was I supposed to do?!']

chandler_dialogue: What do you think shes just gonna sit there quietly? You dont think shes gonna want to make a toast? You dont think shes gonna want to grab the microphone and sing Part-time Lover?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Come on! So she comes to the wedding! I mean it wont be so bad.']

chandler_dialogue: Yknow what? Its gonna be okay. Yknow what? Shes probably not gonna even want to come.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Oh my God, shes not gonna like the chicken that night either is she?!']

chandler_dialogue: No! That was a lie! See how easy that was?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Really?']

chandler_dialogue: Yes!!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: So-so you wouldve just lied?']

chandler_dialogue: Yes!!!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Would it really have been that easy?']

chandler_dialogue: Well actually uh, there was something we wanted to tell you about the wedding. Um, its going to be a small ceremony. Uh, tiny! Were not even sure why were having it.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Didnt you sleep together?', 'Joey: Yeah that really calms me down. And! We have so much in common! She loves sandwiches, sports, although she is a Met fan, not much of an issue now but if were ever to have kids, well thats a', 'Rachel: (gasps) Oh my God! Listen to you talkin about having kids. Oh my Joey. (She goes over and hugs him.) Oh, please dont get married before I do.', 'Joey: Okay.', '[Scene: A Restaurant, Monica and Chandler are on their date with Janice and Clark, however Clark is a no show and Janice is crying the Mississippi River about it.]', 'Janice: Oh. Oh I just cannot believe Clark stood me up!', 'Monica: He might still show up.', 'Janice: Oh, what are you, stupid? Its been three hours.', 'Monica: Is that all?', 'Janice: I should just go on to happier things, okay? Umm, why dont you tell about your lovely wedding?']

chandler_dialogue: I say we go with Careless Whisper.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: No hey Rach, its cool okay? Yknow Im a loner too! (Heads for his room.) Right?', 'Phoebe: Hey Joey, yknow what? You are way to good for her.', 'Rachel: Yeah and honey I promise next time that I will just say good-bye and tell em youre not looking for a relationship.', 'Joey: No! No. Dont do that, just next time make sure she really likes me.', 'Rachel: Well that too. (Joey goes into his room.) Joey?', 'Joey: Yeah?', 'Rachel: Do you want some pancakes?', 'Joey: (coming back out) Finally!', "[Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler and Monica are sitting at the kitchen table and are still trying to decide what to do about Janice.]", 'Monica: What are we gonna do?']

chandler_dialogue: (To Monica) Did she see us yet? Did she see us?
intervening_dialogues: ['Janice: Chandler?']

chandler_dialogue: Arent you just a tinsy bit curious?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Janice, what umm, what are you doing here?', 'Janice: Well umm, I thought I was going to go back to my apartment but then I just felt I couldnt really be alone tonight. (Joey walks into view of the open door behind Janice, sees her, gets a terrified look on his face, and flees in horror.) I was wondering if I could maybe stay here with you, just I really feel that I need to be with family.', 'Monica: (To Chandler) Our kids are gonna call her Aunt Janice arent they?', 'Janice: Please, its because otherwise I really dont know what I might do.']

chandler_dialogue: No-no-no-no, if we let her stay, she will stay forever!
intervening_dialogues: ['Janice: (starting to cry) Do you have any tissues?', 'Monica: Yeah, in-in-in the bathroom.', 'Janice: Okay! (She runs for the bathroom)', 'Monica: Well justwell just let her stay.']

chandler_dialogue: Is that what youre thinking about right now?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Kinda like your Barca lounger.']

chandler_dialogue: Janice, Im sorry but umm, you cant stay here tonight.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: I never stop thinking about it.', 'Janice: Hey you guys, umm do either one of you want to get in there before I take my bath.']

chandler_dialogue: Honestly? Our apartment is a hotbed for electromagnetic activity. Now Monica and I have been immunized, but sadly you have not.
intervening_dialogues: ['Janice: Why not?']

chandler_dialogue: Say again?
intervening_dialogues: ['Janice: Okay, Im going to need a comforter, but did you have a hypoallergenic one because otherwise I get very nasal. (Makes some weird sound) Do you have a cat? Cause its already happening. (Makes a nasal sound) Do you hear that? (She keeps making the nasal sound.)', 'Monica: Oh my God! Oh my God! You have to go!', 'Janice: Why?', 'Monica: Because Chandler still has feelings for you!', 'Janice: He does?']

chandler_dialogue: Feelings, such strong feelings.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Thats right. Thats right. And that is why you cant stay here tonight. And probably why you shouldnt come to the wedding.']

chandler_dialogue: I just wanted to show Monica your book. (Ross just glares at him.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: I mean, I realize that his feelings may never completely go away, but you can.', 'Janice: Ohmy Gawd, I-I understand. I-I am so sorry, Ill go. (Starts for the door.) Good-bye Monica (hugs her), I wish you a lifetime of happiness with him. Chandler, (hugs him) you call me when this goes in the pooper. (Hurries out.)', '[Scene: The librarys Paleontology section, Ross is on patrol and stops a security guard through the stack of books.]', 'Ross: (to the guard) Dont sweat it, Ive got this section covered. Yeah, in fact Ive got this little baby (Turns on a mini-flashlight) to shine in peoples eye(The guard walks away)Okay, see you later.']

chandler_dialogue: No, no, no. No-no-no.
intervening_dialogues: ['Written by: Patty Lin Transcribed by: Eric Aasen With Help from: Didi Chow', "[Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is in the kitchen, Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe are sitting around the table writing one notepads while Chandler is looking over their shoulders.]", 'Ross: (entering) Hey everybody! Happy Thanksgiving!']

chandler_dialogue: No, we're playing this game I learned at work. You have to name all the states in six minutes.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe: Shhhh!', 'Ross: What, are we keeping Thanksgiving a secret this year?']

chandler_dialogue: Now, that's a lot harder than it sounds. You always forget at least one, or in some cases... fourteen (looks over to Monica).
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: What? That's like insanely easy!"]

chandler_dialogue: Oh, okay, time's up!
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: It's a stupid game and I wasn't playing against other people, so technically I didn't lose.", 'Ross: What? You forgot fourteen states?', 'Monica: Nobody cares about the Dakotas. (Thats true in so many ways, trust me, Ive lived in one and been to the other.)']

chandler_dialogue: Oh that's not bad, Pheebs?
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: All right, I got 48.']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, so Rachel's got 48 and Phoebe has the lead invegetables, Joey?
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Oh, I got tired of naming states. So I decided to list the types of celery, and I have one: regular celery.']

chandler_dialogue: Does South Oregon have a sports-team? (Joey strikes one from his list) There you go.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Say hello to the new champ of Chandler's dumb states game.", 'Ross: Wow, how many have you got?', 'Joey: Fifty-six!', "[Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's. Ross is sitting in the couch doing Chandler's game. Chandler is sitting in his barca-lounger. The girls are in the kitchen.]", 'Joey: Hey! How is New England not a state? Huh? They have a sports-team!']

chandler_dialogue: Oooh that may be a New World's record (Looks at his watch and picks up Ross' pad)
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: (counting the place settings) How come we have one extra place setting?', "Monica: 'Cause you invited your assistant.", "Rachel: Oh, right. Sorry. But Tag's not coming; his girlfriend came into town, so he's spending Thanksgiving with her.", "Monica: Oh! Why didn't you tell me? I made him his own individual sweet potato stuffed pumpkin.", "Rachel: Well, I was going to, but then I figured, you know... you're food is so delicious and perfect, you can never have too many of those pumpkin things.", "Monica: Now you think I wouldn't enjoy that, because it is so fake, (Laughs) but I still do.", 'Phoebe: Regular Celery! (Starts to write that on her list) Oh, I already have that. (She gets up and heads for her room)', 'Ross: Done! With time a-to-spare.']

chandler_dialogue: Uh, Magellan? You got 46 states. (Smiles and hands Ross back his pad)
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: You know, I hate to lecture you guys, but it\'s kinda disgraceful, that a group of well-educated adults and Joey can\'t name all the states. Did you ever see a map, or one of those round, colorful things called "a globe?" Hmm?']

chandler_dialogue: I am only one man! (Monica heads out) Okay Ross, time is up!
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: What? That's impossible.", "Joey: 46. Wow! Who's well educated now, Mr. I-forgot-ten-states?", "Monica: All right, I'm out of oven space. I'm gonna turn on Joey's. Please, watch him! Do not let Joey eat any of the food!"]

chandler_dialogue: Look Ross, if you don't know them by now, you will never know them, okay? That is the beauty of this game. It makes you want to kill yourself.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: No, just give me another minute.']

chandler_dialogue: Okay, but if you can'tno dinner!
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: This-this is crazy! I can do this! All right, uhh, I bet I can get all 50 before dinner.']

chandler_dialogue: Sure, and Joey; do not let Ross look at any of the maps or the globe in your apartment.
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: You're on!", "Joey: (gets up) All right. Don't look at my list, Ross, 'cause there's a lot on there that you don't have.", "Monica: (entering, to Joey and Rachel) Hey, did you guys know, that your oven doesn't work?", 'Joey: But the drawer full of take-out menus is okay, right?', "Monica: Ross, I'm gonna use yours, okay?", 'Ross: Pshhshhh!', 'Monica: Chandler? Can you give me a hand? (Grabs her jacket)']

chandler_dialogue: I don't know. Maybe it's because it smells a little weird. It's like old pumpkins or something.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Don't worry, Chandler, it's not a globe of the United States.", "Phoebe: Hey you guys I'm gonna go out and take a walk.", 'Ross: Phoebe, why is your bag moving?', "Phoebe: Oh, it's not!", "Rachel: Seriously, it's moving!", 'Joey: What the hell is in there?', "Phoebe: It's just my knitting that's all! (A dog sticks its head out of Phoebe's bag. Everyone looks puzzled.) Yes! I knit this. I'm very good.", "[Scene: Ross' apartment, Monica and Chandler enter.]", "Monica: Rosss apartment is nice! How come we don't hang out here more often?"]

chandler_dialogue: Which smells delicious!
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: That's my pie!"]

chandler_dialogue: What?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Uh-oh! Uh-oh!']

chandler_dialogue: Tell her, I'm allergic, and I will sue!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: We left Joey alone with the food! (Walks towards the window and looks out) Yep! Yep, I knew it! chandler_dialogue: Huh! Where is the dog?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Oh my god! Where are you? (Looks around.)', "Monica: I'll be right there!", "Phoebe: (Phoebe hangs up and someone knocks on the door. She gasps.) What are you doing here?', 'Tag: I, uh, wanted to see if your offer to spend Thanksgiving with you is still good.', 'Rachel: Well, sure! Come in! (He enters) Well, what-what happened to your girlfriend?', 'Tag: We kinda broke up this morning.', "Rachel: Oh, I'm sorry.", 'Tag: Yeah, so she went back to Ohio.', 'Ross: Ohio!! Thank you!']

chandler_dialogue: Phoebe, we can hear the dog barking!
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: What dog? There-there's no dog here.", 'Joey: Yeah that dog left!', "Monica: (walks to Phoebe's door) Phoebe! Phoebe, open up!", "Phoebe: There's no dog in here."]

chandler_dialogue: What is it doing here?
intervening_dialogues: ["Phoebe: No that's just me coughing! (Doing some weird coughing noises and the dog barks again. Phoebe comes out of the room.) Oh, good, there you are! Listen, um, I have a dog in my room."]

chandler_dialogue: Extremely allergic, okay? If I'm anywhere near a dog for more than 5 minutes, my throat will just close up!
intervening_dialogues: ["Phoebe: Well, I'm watching it for some friends who went out of town. Wait. (She bends down, picks up the dog, and waves with one of its paws) Hello, my name is Clunkers. May I please stay with you nice people?", 'Monica: Oooh, I wish she could stay here, but Chandler is allergic!']

chandler_dialogue: (gasping) Really?

chandler_dialogue: Right, calm down, O'Mally. I'll slip him some money.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: No, to get a table! Places like are always shakin you down. Everybody wants to be paid off.']

chandler_dialogue: Hey, I can be smooth. (Walks back to the Maitre d', very smoothly) Listen, we're a little bit in a hurry, so, if you can get us a table a little quicker, I'd appreciate it. (Shakes his hand)
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: You've got to be smooth about it."]

chandler_dialogue: Okay. (Walks back to Monica)
intervening_dialogues: ["Maitre d': Of course, sir."]

chandler_dialogue: Had the money in the wrong hand. (Shows her his left hand with the money in it)
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: How did it go?']

chandler_dialogue: How do you know so much about this?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ben: When is Santa coming?', 'Ross: Well, how about this year, instead of Santa, we have fun celebrating Hanukkah?', 'Ben: No Santa? Was I bad?', "Ross: No! Oh, no-no-no. Hey, you weren't bad, you've been very good, Ben.", "Ben: Santa's mad at me.", "Ross: No, hey-hey, come on, (He grabs Ben and sits him on his lap) Ben, Santa is not mad at you, okay? Hey, you're-you're his favorite little guy!", "Ben: So Santa's coming?", "Ross: (disappointed) Yes! Santa's coming!", "[Scene: Michelle's, Chandler and Monica are discussing how to bribe the Maitre d'.]", "Monica: It's easy! Just keep it casual! Give him a kind word, shake his hand and give him the money!"]

chandler_dialogue: Richard used to do it, didn't he?
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: I don't know."]

chandler_dialogue: Mustached bastard
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: We'd be eating our soup right now."]

chandler_dialogue: (walks up to the Maitre d') Excuse me...
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: (sees two people exit) Okay, those people just left, come on! Quick! Give him the money and get their table!']

chandler_dialogue: (finds his money) Ahh-hahaha! (Turns around to give the Maitre d' his money, but he isn't there anymore)
intervening_dialogues: ["Male Guest: (to the Maitre d') Good evening. (Shakes his hand)"]

chandler_dialogue: Thank you Gunther, put it there. (He gets up, and shakes Gunther's hand. A bunch of coins fall out his hand. He sits down next to Monica.) Definitely not easier with coins. (Joey gets up and picks up the coins. Chandler thinks, Joey is just helping him to pick them up.) Thank you.
intervening_dialogues: ["[Scene: The Hallway, Phoebe comes up the stairs and hears drumming coming from Joey and Rachel's, so she enters smiling and then sees that Rachel, not Joey, is the one playing.]", 'Rachel: (stopping at Phoebes entrance) Ha!', "Phoebe: So you like the drums! That's, that's great! Yknow, I was worried, that, you know, they would maybe an unbearable living situation. All right, okay, well, apparently not! So, yay!", 'Joey: Hey-hey, Pheebs, check it out, we already learned a song. (To Rachel) Ready? One, two, three, four...', 'Rachel and Joey: Tequila!!', "Phoebe: That's fun. (She exits disappointedly.)", '[Scene: Central Perk, Gunther is serving Chandler and Monica coffee.]', 'Gunther: Here you go.']

chandler_dialogue: Hey Pheebs!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Thank you. (He gets up and puts on his jacket.) (Phoebe enters) Hey Pheebs!', 'Phoebe: Hey!', 'Joey: Here. (Gives her the coins) Now I only owe you $49.50.']

chandler_dialogue: If you wanna give Joey a Christmas present that disrupts the entire building, why not get him something a little bit more subtle, like a wrecking ball, or a vile of small pox to release in the hallway?
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Hey! (she sits down next to him)']

chandler_dialogue: (entering in a Santa costume) Ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas!
intervening_dialogues: ['Ben: Wow! Thanks!', "Ross: You're welcome, Ben. Merry Christmas, ooh, and Happy Hanukkah!", "Ben: Are you for Hanukkah, too? Because I'm part-Jewish.", 'Ross: (gasps) You are? Me, too!', 'Monica: Because Armadillos also wandered in the desert?', 'Ross: (to Monica) You wanna wander in the hall? (to Ben) Ooh, hey Ben, what if the Holiday Armadillo told you all about the festival of lights?', 'Ben: Cool!', 'Ross: Yeah!', 'Monica: Come on Ben.', 'Ross: Years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees...']

chandler_dialogue: Hey! (Grunts as Ben hits him at full speed.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Ben: Santa! (Runs to Chandler and hugs him)']

chandler_dialogue: Well, I'm here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weirdturtle-man?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: What are you doing here, Santa?']

chandler_dialogue: What?
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: I'm the Holiday Armadillo, your part-Jewish friend. You sent me here to give Ben some presents. Remember?"]

chandler_dialogue: You bet I did, Ben, put it there! (He shakes Ben's hand, but the money falls out of his hands) (to Monica) Well, it would have worked this time, if his hands weren't so damn small! (Realizes, that Ben is standing right there) Ho, ho, ho!
intervening_dialogues: ['Ben: Did you bring me any presents, Santa?']

chandler_dialogue: You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Okay Ben, why don't you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo, and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There's a sentence, I never thought I'd say.", 'Ross: (to Chandler) What are you doing?']

chandler_dialogue: Why?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Thank you, but, but you gotta leave.']

chandler_dialogue: But I didn't get to shape my belly like a bowl full of jelly.
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: Because, I'm finally getting him excited about Hanukkah, and, and you're-youre wrecking it."]

chandler_dialogue: Fine, I'll give the suit back.
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: I'm sorry, Chandler but this, this is really important to me."]

chandler_dialogue: Santa? Really?
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: (to Chandler) Hey, you think, you can keep it another night? (She has a really teasing look on her face and keeps twirling Chandler's beard.)"]

chandler_dialogue: Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Yes, is that okay?']

chandler_dialogue: Then it's okay! (They kiss.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: No.']

chandler_dialogue: Because, if Santa and the HolidayArmadillo? (Ross nods) ...are ever in the same room for too long the universe will implode. Merry Christmas!
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Okay Ben, Santa has to go. Say good-bye!', 'Ben: No! Why does he have to go?']

chandler_dialogue: Well, I'll stay, but only because I wanna hear about Hanukkah. Ben, will you sit here with Santa and learn about Hanukkah?
intervening_dialogues: ["Ben: No! Why can't the Armadillo leave? I want Santa!", 'Ross: Fine, I-I give up. Santa, Santa can stay.']

chandler_dialogue: My favorite part was when Superman flew all the Jews out of Egypt. (Glaring at Joey whos nodding.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Oh please, I hate packing, its closer to work, and we do have fun. Although, Im really gonna miss living with you.', 'Phoebe: Oh me too.', 'Rachel: I know. (They hug.) Oh-oh, wait did you hear that-hear that? Listen, Im gettin something from your grandmother, she said that since you get to keep the one bedroom apartment you should give Rachel the purple chair?', 'Phoebe: No, I do not hear that.', "[Scene: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Santa (Chandler), Superman (Joey), Ben, and Monica are listening to the Holiday Armadillo (Ross) finish telling the story of Hanukkah.]", 'Ross: and the miracle was that that little bit of oil that shouldve just lasted just one day, burned for', 'Ben: (answering him) Eight whole days.', 'Ross: Thats right, and thats why we celebrate Hanukkah today. The end.', 'Ben: Awesome!', 'Ross: Yeah?']

chandler_dialogue: Ohh. Mmm.
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Oh.', 'Phoebe: Okay, I understand why Superman is here, but why is there a porcupine at the Easter Bunnys funeral?', "[Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is closing the door on the tarantula cage.]", 'Rachel: I got it!', 'Joey: (yelling from the bedroom) Is it back in the cage?', 'Rachel: Its back in cage!', 'Joey: Cage closed?', 'Rachel: Joey, would you just come out here and stop being such a baby!', 'Written by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan Transcribed by: Eric Aasen With Help from: Aaron Howard-Miller', '[Scene: Chandler and Monicas, Chandler is sitting at the kitchen table eating cheesecake. The box it came in is also on the table.]']

chandler_dialogue: Hey, you have got to try this cheesecake.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: (Comes in the front door and walks towards the kitchen.) Hi.']

chandler_dialogue: (nervously) It was at the front door. When I got home. Somebody sent it to us.
intervening_dialogues: ["Rachel: Oh, yknow I'm not that much of a sweet tooth. I(Chandler puts a forkful of the cheesecake in her mouth.)Wow. My God, so creamy. Oh my God, this is the best cheesecake I have ever had. Where did you get this? (She reaches over to look at the label on the box.)"]

chandler_dialogue: Ino! I didn't read the box before I opened it. And you can't return a box after you've opened the box.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Chandler, this is not addressed to you. This is addressed to Mrs. Braverman downstairs. (Gasping) Thief.']

chandler_dialogue: Because it's too delicious.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Why, why not?']

chandler_dialogue: No-no-no! It is going to be okay, because Mrs. Braverman is gonna send away for a free one and that way we all win! The only losers are the big cheesecake conglomerate, (Reading the label) Mommas Little Bakery. (Pause) I feel terrible, Im a horrible, horrible, horrible person.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Chandler, you stole this cheesecake. That is wrong.']

chandler_dialogue: So
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: (taking a bite) Oh, Im sorry what?', '[Scene: Central Perk, everyone except Rachel is there as Joey gets up and starts putting on his coat.]', 'Joey: All right, I should get going, big day a work. chandler_dialogue: Oh, whats at 8:00?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Ah-ah-ah Mr. Smartie Pants, its just not my character thats not brain dead. Hey, so Pheebs, we still on for tonight?', 'Phoebe: Absolutely!', 'Joey: Ill see you at 8:00.', 'Phoebe: Okay. (Joey exits.)']

chandler_dialogue: Well, maybe since the age of 9, Frannies made some new friends.

I mean I knew that mom and dad were invited, but I thought that was it! I mean from the ages 7 to 9 Frannie and I were inseparable!']

chandler_dialogue: I used to undress my cousin Glenn. (Monica looks at him then sushes him.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Well l-look okay, its probably just a mistake. Let me call Aunt Sheryl okay? Maybe you are invited and the invitation just got lost in the mail.', 'Monica: Yeah, well you call her and tell her that yknow when we were kids her precious little Frannie tried to undress me several times, okay? And if I hadnt have stopped her, there probably wouldnt even be a wedding to go too.', 'Ross: Yknow, she tried to undress me too.']

chandler_dialogue: Another cheesecake came! They delivered it to the wrong address again!
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Phoebe hes right, that is the rule.', 'Phoebe: I dont accept this rule. When me make plans, I expect you to show up. chandler_dialogue: I cant seem to say goodbye.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: So just bring it back downstairs, whats the problem?']

chandler_dialogue: Well Ive forgotten what it tastes like okay?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Are you serious?! Chandler, we ate an entire cheesecake two days ago and you want more?']

chandler_dialogue: (closing the box) Yknow what? Forget it! We are just hungry! We have not had lunch! We are just light-headed! So let us go out and have lunch and forget about the cheesecake.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: It was cheesecake. It was fine. It had a buttery, crumbly, graham cracker crust, with a very rich yet light, cream cheese filling (Pause) Wow! My whole mouth just filled with saliva!']

chandler_dialogue: Good idea. Where do you want to go to lunch?
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Yeah and well drop it off downstairs so that were not tempted.']

chandler_dialogue: Well, thank you for lunch.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: (interrupting) Not broad backed!', 'Monica: Wait a minute, yknow, youre bringing me!', 'Ross: What? I cant cancel on Joan!', 'Monica: Why not?!', 'Ross: BecDid you not hear me?! Shes an assistant professor in the Linguistics department, okay? Theyre wild! Why do you want to come anyway?', 'Monica: Because! Shes my cousin. I mean, we grew up together! Were family yknow? Well thats important to me.', 'Ross: Okay, all right, Ill take you. Ill go call Joan. (Does so.)', 'Joey: Aww thats nice. Family should be there, huh? This is her wedding, happiest day of her life.', 'Monica: (laughs) Well see.', '[Scene: The Lobby of Chandler and Rachels building, Chandler and Rachel are returning from lunch.]']

chandler_dialogue: So apparently we just dont pay for food anymore. (Rachel laughs then Chandler notices something.) Do you see what I see?
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: What? Wait a minute, I didnt pay, I thought you paid!']

chandler_dialogue: Mrs. Braverman must be out. (They move closer to it.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: (gasps) Its still there! (The cheesecake they returned to Mrs. Braverman is still lying in front of her door.)']

chandler_dialogue: By then, the cheesecake may have gone bad. We dont want her to come back to bad cheesecake.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: She could be out of town. Maybe shell be gone for months.']

chandler_dialogue: Well, we dont want that.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: No that could kill her.']

chandler_dialogue: But we should take it.
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: No so were protecting her.']

chandler_dialogue: Why?
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: But we should move quick.']

chandler_dialogue: Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! (Rachel grabs the cheesecake and they take off upstairs.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Because I think I just heard her moving around in there.']

chandler_dialogue: Im full, and yet I know if I stop eating this, Ill regret it.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?', 'Phoebe: Uh-huh. (They go over and talk.)', 'Monica: What are you doing?', 'Phoebe: Well, I have plans with Joey tonight.', 'Monica: So! Hell understand!', 'Phoebe: No he wont. And thats not even the point! Monica, I made a whole speech about you do not cancel plans with friends! And now yknow what? No, if I dont have my principles, I dont have anything!', 'Monica: God, you are so strong.', 'Phoebe: Or! I should rush through dinner with Joey and I can meet David at 9:00!', "[Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel and Chandler are eating the cheesecake right out of the box.]", 'Rachel: (taking a bite) Oh my God! That is so good!']

chandler_dialogue: What are you doing tonight?
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: (entering) Hey!', 'Rachel: Hey!', 'Joey: (seeing what theyre doing) What do you got there?', 'Rachel: Oh its umm, its tofu cake. Do you want some? (He makes a disgusted noise and heads for his room, Chandler follows him in.)']

chandler_dialogue: Dude! Dude! (Motions that Joey should pull up his pants.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Huh? Uh (He starts taking off his pants.)']

chandler_dialogue: Oh really? Uh, Monica said she had a date at 9:00.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Oh! (Pulls up his pants.) Sorry. Uh, Ive got those plans with Phoebe, why?']

chandler_dialogue: Thats what Monica said.
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: What?! Tonight?!']

chandler_dialogue: Are you eating the cheesecake without me?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Fine!', 'Phoebe: Yeah! (She exits.)', 'Joey: (to the waiter) What are you still doin here?! I-I-I-I didnt think you were coming.', 'Phoebe: Oh, I wouldnt miss this.', 'David: Well, Im very glad youre here. (Kisses her hand.)', 'Phoebe: Oh, youre such a gentleman. (Grabs his arm.) Come on! Were going to my place! (Drags him off to her place.)', "[Scene: Joey and Rachel's, Rachel is eating the cheesecake and Chandler enters and catches her in the act.]"]

chandler_dialogue: I will give you a hundred dollars to whistle right now. (She tries to whistle and blows little chunks of cheesecake out of her mouth.) How can you eat the cheesecake without me?!
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: (with a mouthful) Mm-mmm. (Nods no.)']

chandler_dialogue: Yknow what? I dont trust you with this cake anymore! And I got it first, and Im takin it back! (Grabs the cheesecake and heads for his apartment.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Oh, what are you going to do?! Are you gonna go run tell Monica?! Are you gonna tell Joey?! No! Because then you will have to tell them what we did! We are desert stealers! We are living outside the law!']

chandler_dialogue: Oh yes!
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: What?! What?!']

chandler_dialogue: Oh yes!
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Wait a minute!']

chandler_dialogue: Oh yes! Oh yes!
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Oh no-no-no-no-no, no you dont!']

chandler_dialogue: Well thats not fair, youve already had some!
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: You think I trust you with it?! No! Were gonna split it! You take half and I take half!']

chandler_dialogue: What do we use to split it?
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: What? Oh, well then yknow what? I think Monica would be very interested to know that you called her cheesecake dry and mealy.']

chandler_dialogue: (examining the cake) Okay well, this side looks bigger. Uh Theres more crust on this side. Yknow? So, maybe if I measured
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Okay! (Grabs a knife and cuts it in half.) All right, pick a half.']

chandler_dialogue: All right, Ill pick that one. (Points.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Oh for God sake just pick a piece!']

chandler_dialogue: (gloatingly and holding his piece) Ohhh!

No switching, and dont come crying to me if you eat your piece to fast. (As shes saying that she is backing out the door, when she finishes she turns around to return to her place, stumbles and drops the cheesecake on the floor.) Oh!!!!']

chandler_dialogue: Oh-ho-ho-ho-no! No! No switching! No sharing, and dont come crying to me! Ha-ha-ha! I may just sit here and have my cake all day! Just sit here in the hallway and eat my (Rachel knocks the plate from his hand and it falls on the floor. That process leaves just the forkful Chandler has, Rachel starts to go after that little bit and Chandler retreats into his apartment.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Okay, you gotta give me some of your piece.']

chandler_dialogue: Stick to your side!

Yay! Look! Theres a piece that doesnt have floor on it!']

chandler_dialogue: (looking up with her) Thats a plane!

You might as well look for the moon on a bright sunny day.]', 'Monica: (looking up) Ross, whens this comet thing start?', 'Ross: Well, technically it seven billion years ago (Well, technically youd be able to see it for days, well nights; that is if you could see it with all of the bright lights of New York.)', 'All: (groaning) Oh no! Oh no! (They all start to get up a leave.)', 'Ross: Okay! Okay! Fine, Ill stop! No teaching, okay? Well just watch the pretty light streaking across the sky. (Comets dont streak across the sky, meteors do.) Okay? Whos official name is Bapstein-King.', 'All: Okay! Okay! (They start to leave again.)', 'Phoebe: (looking up) There it is! Oh, look at that! Isnt Mother Nature amazing?']

chandler_dialogue: (with a quivering voice) No, Im not!
intervening_dialogues: ['Tag: Hey, I wonder if you can see my apartment from up here.', 'Rachel: No. No, you cant.', 'Tag: What?', 'Rachel: Oh I dont-I dont know.', 'Ross: Man, look at all those stars! It really, really makes you wonder, doesnt it?', 'Joey: (looking through his binoculars at a nearby building) Yknow what else makes you wonder?', 'Ross: Huh?', 'Joey: Check out the rack on this chick! (Turns around to point it out to Ross and finds that Ross is glaring at him. So he quickly puts his binoculars to his eyes and starts looking for the comet.)', '[Scene: The Roof, continued from earlier.]', 'Monica: Okay, weve been out here for two hours and we havent seen any stupid comets. Can we go now? I mean, Chandlers getting chilly. (She walks over to where Chandler is bundled up in a big coat and shivering.)']

chandler_dialogue: Because its flattering! (Shivers harder) Come on Monica! Come on Monica! (He goes inside.)
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Then why are you wearing Monicas jacket?']

intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Deep Impact was the one with Robert Duval, Armageddon is whats going to happen to you if you wake me up.']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah...!?

chandler_dialogue: Allright, I'm gonna watch it... I mean look, it's probably not even what I think it is... And even if it is... It can't possibly be as bad as what I'm picturing in my head... (laughs nervously) Can it?

chandler_dialogue: Then you're gonna have to watch it for me.

intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: <laughs> Oh yeah, like I'm going to let you   talk to the queen.", 'Joey: wow, the parade is really good this year. Man those   horses can crap.', 'TV announcer: Next up is a marching band from Muskogee, OK.']

chandler_dialogue: What are you going to do?

chandler_dialogue: Ok. So if we both had Emma and I die <knocks   on table> she'd have to give her up.

intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Ross and Rachel don't know what they're talking about.   I mean its not like their so responsible. Emma is a product of a bottle of   Merlot and a five year old condom."]

chandler_dialogue: That's actually why. Look, I'm starting a whole new career now, and I'm not saying that I don't want to have a baby, I'm just saying maybe we could wait a little while.

chandler_dialogue: Yeah, me too. Look, I'll just get my old job back.

I mean, now you're unemployed and in a little while you'll find a new job that'll keep you really busy. There's always gonna be a reason not to do this, but I think once the baby comes, forget about all those reasons."]

I mean, the apartment's gonna be a mess, I won't have time to clean it. What if the baby gets into the ribbon drawer? Messes up all the ribbons?! What if there's no room for a ribbon drawer, because the baby's stuff takes up all the space!? Where will all the ribbons go!?!"]

chandler_dialogue: Oh no no no no, I'd love to be somebody's assistant! Answering phones, getting coffee, I live for that stuff! And I'm not too mature... farts, boobies, butt cracks!
intervening_dialogues: ["Steve: Chandler, hi! I'm sure you've heard we filled the three positions. We just felt that with your maturity and experience, you wouldn't be happy being someone's assistant."]

chandler_dialogue: Me, that guy who just said butt cracks?

chandler_dialogue: Ok well, thanks, you won't regret it. I'll see you tomorrow (hangs up).

chandler_dialogue: Thanks, man.

intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: (high pitched voice) Check again please!', "Receptionist: I'm sorry, it's not here.", 'Ross: Not there.']

chandler_dialogue: You know what? You dont need a thesaurus, just write from  here, (points at his own heart) your full sized aortic pump.

chandler_dialogue: Word!

chandler_dialogue: Oh, then I'll tell you. My agency was bidding for   a big account and they got it! It's my first national commercial!

chandler_dialogue: First of all. Bravo. Uh, but I really don't think you're right for this. The part calls for a stuffy college professor.

intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: What do you mean? chandler_dialogue: Fine!

intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: (sounds disappointed) Oh.']

intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: (looks at him suspiciously) But, ehm... you watched the tape?']

chandler_dialogue: (looks surprised) What!? Of course I did!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: (sounds confident) You didn't watch the tape."]

chandler_dialogue: I'm not lying to you, I watched it!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Look, it's one thing not to cast me, but to lie to me?"]

chandler_dialogue: I watched it!

(determined to spell it correctly) B - O - S ...', 'Benjamin: No, it starts with a silent "M".', 'Ross: Oh come on!!', "[Scene: Joey and Rachel's apartment. Chandler and Rachel are talking.]"]

chandler_dialogue: What did I just say?
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: But you are a liar.']

chandler_dialogue: I know. You're right. What's it gonna take for you to forgive me?

chandler_dialogue: Lying is wrong!
intervening_dialogues: ['[Scene: Central Perk. Monica, Phoebe and Rachel are on the couch.]', 'Monica: Oh my God!', 'Rachel: Excellent!', 'Joey: Now, what do you say?']

intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: No, no, no. The next time it's gonna be a Hawaii at sunset. [pause] But maybe the time after that!", "[Scene: Monica and Chandler's apartment]", 'Joey: Hey!']

chandler_dialogue: What...? NO!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: (pointing at himself) Celebrity.', "Monica: Ok, so I think I'm just about done here, unless you have any bad stuff hidden somewhere, like... porn or cigarettes?"]

intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Chandler?']

intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Ok, so there's not a magazine under the couch, or a pack of cigarettes taped to the back of the toilet tank, or a filthy video in the VCR?"]

(pause) All right, well, who cares, I dont need a pretty veil and a fancy dress.', 'Monica: Thats right. What I really want is a great big wedding (she covers her mouth)', 'Monica: Yay!']

chandler_dialogue: I dont think you can do that!
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Well, Ill just ask for it back!']

chandler_dialogue: Thats sweet, honey, but save something for the adoption Lady.

chandler_dialogue: Oh, because we love kids. Love em to death.Well, not actually to death, that's just a figure of speech - we love kids the appropriate amount... as allowed by law.
intervening_dialogues: ['Charity guy: Hey, its not my business, (he takes their check from a drawer) besides its probably a good thing. We really would have been spoiling the children, all those food, and warm clothing', 'Phoebe: Hey, thats not fair! A persons wedding is important! And especially to me! Ok? I didnt have a graduation party! And I didnt go to Prom. And I spent my sweet sixteen being chased round a tire yard by an escaped mental patient who is his own words wanted to kill me or whatever. So I deserve a real celebration and I am not gonna let some sweaty little man make me feel badly about it.( She storms out)', 'Mike: She could have been talking about either one of us.', '[Scene: Monicas apartment. Somebody knocks the door]', 'Laura: Hi, I am Laura, I am here for your adoption interview.', 'Monica: Hi, I am Monica and this is Chandler. Please come in.', 'Laura: Thank you!', 'Monica: Would you like something to drink?', 'Laura: Oh, water would be fine.', 'Monica: Ok. Great. I am so glad that you are here. Were really excited about getting this process started.']

chandler_dialogue: But other than that... wholesome, wholesome building.
intervening_dialogues: ['Laura: Your place is just lovely.', 'Monica: Ah, thank you. This building does have a wholesome family feel to it.', "Laura: You know, I... I feel like I've been here before. Are any other couples in the building adopting?", 'Monica: Is that that couple on the first floor? Because we should get a baby before them. Yeah! That guy tried to sell me drugs. (Laura looks shocked)']

chandler_dialogue: What?
intervening_dialogues: ['Laura: Oh...']

chandler_dialogue: Of course it was!
intervening_dialogues: ['Laura: I just realized why I remember this place.', 'Monica: Really? What is it?', "Laura: Oh, it's nothing. I went on a date with a guy who lived in this building and it didn't end very well.", "Monica: Ohh... that wouldn't by any chance be... Joey Tribbiani?", 'Laura: Yes!']

chandler_dialogue: RAT BASTARD!
intervening_dialogues: ["Laura: Yeah, we had a really great night and in the morning he promised he would call me and he didn't."]

chandler_dialogue: Oh, it's just some crazy guy who roams the halls here. He's great with kids though.
intervening_dialogues: ["Laura: So you're not friends with him?", 'Monica and Chandler: OH GOD NO! Nope, no, no, no. No! No, no. Nope! No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no. NO! (finally Monica concludes) No!', "Laura: Well, I'm sorry I brought it up. So, are either one of you planning on staying at home with your child... (someone knocks on the door)", 'Joey: (form the other side of the door) Hellooo? Anybody in there order a celebrity?    (He starts to enter the apartment and Chandler runs to the door and shuts it back in his face) OW!', 'Laura: What was that?']

chandler_dialogue: (Screams to interrupt Joey) AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA......AAAaaa-doption!!
intervening_dialogues: ["Rachel: (looks at him suspiciously) I know what this is all about... You've always been jealous of my hair.", "Ross: Look, I just think you're an adult, okay? And you should get over your silly fears.", "Rachel: Alright fine. I'll do it.", 'Ross: Good.', 'Rachel: If you hold a spider.', 'Ross: (He freaks out and starts jumping around brushing his sweater) WHAT? WHERE? WHERE?', 'Rachel: IF you hold a spider.', 'Ross: I know. (Rachel bends down to Emma and Ross looks over his shoulder again,    afraid)', "[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment. Chandler is still leaning against the door, keeping Joey out, who is still banging and shouting on the other side.]", "Joey: Guys? Everything ok? It's me, Joe..."]

chandler_dialogue: Oh, just like I said. That crazy... Bert... roaming the halls. (Joey bangs on the door again)
intervening_dialogues: ["Laura: What's going on?"]

chandler_dialogue: WE'LL TALK TO YOU LATER, BERT. EVERYTHNG'S FINE!!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Guys!?', "Monica: Keep on roaming Bert! We don't want any crazy today!", "Joey: What's going on?"]

chandler_dialogue: Oh yeah! He has a caretaker. His older brother... Ernie.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Everything doesn't sound fine!", 'Laura: Is he alright out there by himself?']

chandler_dialogue: (nervous smile) You can't make this stuff up!
intervening_dialogues: ['Laura: Bert and Ernie!']

chandler_dialogue: What the hell are you doing?
intervening_dialogues: ['Phoebe: Yeah, I really do. You know, I had nothing growing up. (thinks for a few seconds) Just like the kids I took the money from.', "Mike: No! No, no. I see where this is going. Don't make me go back there.", "Phoebe: Look, I can't have a wedding with this money now. It's tainted.", "Mike: Alright, fine. We'll give the money back.", "Phoebe: And if that guy at the charity gives us a hard time, my friend hasn't shot anyone in a really long time.", "[Scene: Monica and Chandler's. They are preparing to show Laura around. Laura is standing with her back to the window, Chandler and Monica are standing on either side of her, facing each other.", 'Laura: Well, I must say, this seems like a lovely environment to raise a child in.', "Monica: Oh, by the way, you are more than welcome to look under any of the furniture, because, believe me, you won't find any porn or cigarettes under there!", 'Laura: Oh! Well, actually, before we look around, let me make sure I have everything I need up to here...', "Monica: (Pulls Laura into the spare room) Why don't I show you the baby's room?"]

chandler_dialogue: Well, we're not.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Well, you wouldn't let me in, so I thought you were in trouble."]

chandler_dialogue: We don't have a code word.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: But you called me 'Bert'!? That's our code word for danger!"]

chandler_dialogue: Any room that isn't behind this couch! (laughs nervously)
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: We don't? We really should. From now on, 'Bert' will be our code word for danger.", "Monica: So that was the baby's room. (They come out and Chandler throws Joey behind the couch and puts his foot on him. Monica looks at Chandler)", 'Monica: (To Chandler) What room should we see next?']

chandler_dialogue: (escorting Joey to the door) You have to get out of here. You slept with our social worker and you never called her back and she is still pissed, so she can't see you.
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: (laughs nervously as well, Laura looks confused) (To Laura) Some people don't get him, but I think he's really funny! (She takes Laura to their own bedroom).", 'Joey: (quivering with anger) I did not care for that!']

chandler_dialogue: Ok!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Ok, ok! (He leaves)']

chandler_dialogue: What?
And for the last time, we do not want to be friends with you! And we don't want to buy your bat! (Joey lowers his bat)
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: I forgot my bat.', 'Laura: Oh my God!']

chandler_dialogue: I can explain... Joey...
intervening_dialogues: ['Laura: What are you doing here?', 'Joey: (to Chandler) Bert! Bert! Bert! Bert!', 'Laura: Are you friends with him?']

chandler_dialogue: Oh, that's really ok.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Oh... yeah... Probably you don't even remember my name. It's Joey, by the way. And don't bother telling me yours, because I totally remember it... lady. Yeah! I waited weeks for you to call me.", 'Laura: I gave you my number, you never called me.', "Joey: No, no! Don't try to turn this around on me, ok? I'm not some kind of... social work, ok, that you can just... do.", "Laura: (embarrassed towards Chandler and Monica) Well, I'm pretty sure I gave you my number.", "Joey: Really? Think about it. Come on! You're a beautiful woman, smart, funny, we had a really good time, huh? If I had your number, why wouldn't I call you?", "Laura: I don't know... Well, maybe I'm wrong... I'm sorry...", 'Joey: No, no, hey, no! Too late for apologies... ok? You broke my heart. You know how many women I had to sleep with to get over you? (and he leaves the apartment, leaving her shocked)', 'Laura: Joey, wait!', "Joey: (acting sad) NO! I waited a long time, I can't wait anymore... (and closes the door behind him)", "Laura: (laughing nervously) I'm sorry that you had to see that. I'm so embarrassed..."]

chandler_dialogue: Wrong number?
intervening_dialogues: ["Phoebe: But... but... but we're giving you this!", "Charity guy: Yeah... And I'm giving it back to you... Come on! Consider it a contribution. (gives the check to Phoebe)", 'Phoebe: (looks at the amount on the check, and gasps) Well, this is very generous!', 'Charity guy: Please, take the check, go have a great wedding and a wonderful life together.', 'Mike: Well, I mean... It sounds good to me. And that way we can save up, come back in a few years and make an even bigger donation.', 'Charity guy: Absolutely! And when you do, make sure you ask for Brian.', 'Phoebe: Oh, is that you?', 'Charity guy: No!', "[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment. They are sitting in their living room when the phone rings.]", "Monica: Hello...? Oh hi... Oh my God...! Really...? I can't wait to tell Chandler... Ok, goodbye. (hangs up)"]

chandler_dialogue: That's great!
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: It was Laura... She gave us a great report and we are officially on the waiting list.']

chandler_dialogue: Hello...? Have you seen Joey's bat?
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Now we just have to wait for a call and... and someone tells us there's a baby waiting for us. Oh..."]

chandler_dialogue: Yeah. We don't feel like we can host Thanksgiving this year.
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: There you go! Good for you! And you know what, I'm actually getting used to this little guy. I don't really even feel him in here anymore.", "Rachel: That's because he's on your neck.", 'Ross: Well... (realizes, screaming like a little girl, trying to get rid of the spider) Whaa... aaah... aaahhh...', 'Rachel: ROSS!', 'Written by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan  Produced by: Robert Carlock & Wendy Knoller  Transcribed by: Coffee Mug, Eleonora, Sebastiano & Vanessa Final check by Kim', '[Scene: Central Perk. Monica and Chandler enter, the others are sitting on the couch.]', 'Monica: Hey guys!', 'Rachel: Hi!', 'Phoebe: Hey!', 'Monica: We need to talk to you about something.']

chandler_dialogue: Well, it's just with uhm, work and the stress of adoption, we just don't feel like we have the energy. Plus, we don't think it's fair that every year the burden falls on us.
intervening_dialogues: ['All: What?', 'Phoebe: Hey!', 'Ross: Are you kidding?']

chandler_dialogue: No, no! We made this decision together.
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: (skeptical) That doesn't sound like you... That's Monica talking!"]

chandler_dialogue: Don't let yourself get manipulated this way!
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Don't you put words in people's mouths, you put turkey in people's mouths!", "Rachel: I can't believe this! This is Emma's first Thanksgiving!", "Monica: No, it's not!", "Rachel: It's not? (whispering to Ross) When was she born?", "Phoebe: Well, personally I think it's great you're giving yourself a break.", 'Monica: Thank you, Pheebs!', "Phoebe: Sure. It's just as well... I mean, last year wasn't very good. I think she's losing her touch.", 'Monica: What? You are way off, lady!', "Phoebe: Am I? Really? Am I? Well, why don't you cook Thanksgiving dinner and prove me wrong! Well, think about it, think about it, you'll be trying to top than you did last year. You'd be in competition... with yourself.", "Monica: That's my favourite kind! Okay, we are doing this!"]

chandler_dialogue: We are supposed to make these decisions together! Did you not watch the Doctor Phil I taped for you?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Hey, stay out of this, Chandler! This is between me... and ME!']

chandler_dialogue: Why come all the way from Kansas to do that?
intervening_dialogues: ["Rachel: Phoebe, just the idea of pitting one baby against another, I mean, you know, and judging who's cuter just for a trophy...", 'Rachel: And a thousand dollars.', "Rachel: ...is something I'm very interested in! Oh please, do not tell Ross. He still believes that (in a deep voice, mocking Ross) what's in the inside is important...", 'Phoebe: Okay, oh, and Emma needs a cowgirl outfit for the competition.', 'Rachel: Where am I gonna get a cowgirl outfit on Thanksgiving?', 'Phoebe: Well, I was thinking...', "Rachel: Oh, take the clothes of Joey's Cabbage Patch Kid.", 'Phoebe: Yeah!', "[Scene: Monica and Chandler's apartment. Chandler is watching TV and Monica is cooking]", "Monica: (Chandler's laughing) Did someone drop the baton again?"]

chandler_dialogue: You know what just occurred to me? This could be our last Thanksgiving just the two of us. I mean, we could be getting a baby soon!
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: (she tastes what she has cooked) I don't get older. I just get better!"]

chandler_dialogue: Somebody is gonna pick us.
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: You don't know that."]

chandler_dialogue: I'm telling ya! It's gonna happen. Next year it's gonna be you, me and the little Hemingway Bing. (pause) What, he's my favourite author!
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Yeah, but we haven't heard a thing from the adoption agency and it has been weeks!"]

chandler_dialogue: (after a long pause) "The Firm"?
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Name one of his books.']

chandler_dialogue: You know, you always cook this meal all by yourself. Let me help this year.
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Ok, let's see... uhm, okay, the turkey is in the oven, the stuffing is ready..."]

chandler_dialogue: I'm serious, let me do something, just not the turkey or the stuffing, nothing "high profile".
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Oh, Chandler, that's sweet. But you don't have to do everything Doctor Phil tells you to do."]

chandler_dialogue: Tell me more.
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Ok, let's see... Oh, the cranberry sauce, it is easy to make and no-one really cares about it."]

chandler_dialogue: You obviously haven't tasted my Palmolive potatoes!
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Okay, I'm gonna go check on something across the hall. You start by washing these (she gives Chandler a bowl with cranberries. Then, while she's going outside, she sees him with a bottle of soap in his hands) Not with soap!! (she leaves)"]

chandler_dialogue: Oh my God!
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: Hey! Hey, guess what Joey has!', "Joey: Three tickets to today's Rangers game!!", 'Ross: Dude, I wanted him to guess.', 'Joey: Oh.']

chandler_dialogue: Hmm, the game's at one.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Yeah, they're great seats too!", 'Ross: Guess where they are?', 'Joey: Center ice.', 'Ross: Did I do something to you?']

chandler_dialogue: Dinner is at four, we'll never gonna make it back.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: So?']

chandler_dialogue: You say that now, but it could take us a long time to get back home. Plus Joey could get lost and and they could have to page us to go pick him up.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: So we'll leave before it's over, we'll be back in time."]

chandler_dialogue: Look, Monica has been working hard all day, she didn't wanna host this thing in the first place, we shouldn't go!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Dude, two times that happened!']

chandler_dialogue: Okay. (pause) And get ready to taste my very special cranberries. Or should I say... chanberries!
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: He's right, man.", 'Joey: Right, I guess. Alright, so see you at four.']

chandler_dialogue: I can't believe they are not here! I slave and I slave for what? They've ruined cranberry day!
intervening_dialogues: ['Joey: Ohhhh! These seats are great!', "Ross: I know, I know! When I was here for Holidays on Ice (Joey looks around worried hoping no one heard that) I was sitting so far away Michelle Kwan couldn't read my banner!", "Joey: (looks at the time) Wow, hey, we'd better get going. If we don't leave right now, we'll be late for dinner.", "Ross: Oh, but it's a kind game! chandler_dialogue: (peeping) Everything is so distorted! Looks like Joey has a giant hand! Which says "Rangers" on it. They went to the game!
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Ohhh! Let me see! Oh God, I can't believe this! They're an hour late and they're just staying out there, talking!"]

chandler_dialogue: (looking through the peephole again) Ross' shirt is torn.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: (gasps) Oooh! They are in for a world of pain!']

chandler_dialogue: Yeah, and there's a bowl of cranberry sauce that... (speaking lower to Monica) what happens to cranberry sauce?
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: What is that?', "Joey: That's fire. Beats everything.", 'Phoebe: Oh, really? Does it beat water balloon? Well played, Phoebe Buffay, well played.', "Rachel: Alright, enough, enough, come on. Let's just all go in at the same time.", "All: Alright, okay. (starts to knock on the door) Alright, you guys. We're so sorry we're late. Please let us in, so we can have dinner together.", "Monica: No! Everything's cold. The turkey's dried out and the... the stuffing is all soggy."]

chandler_dialogue: (relieved) Oh thank God!
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: (Rolling her eyes) Nothing. It's fine."]

chandler_dialogue: (looking through the peephole) That's a lie, you went to the game, I can see Joey's hand.
intervening_dialogues: ["Ross: Come on you guys, we're sorry, alri...? Our subway broke down."]

chandler_dialogue: Guys, I'd listen to her. The vein is bigger than I've ever seen it. (Monica looks at Chandler)
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross: (to Joey, who is wearing a blue, 3 foot hand) FOR THE LOVE OF GOD TAKE IT OFF!! (he stuffs the slice in is mouth and gives the foil back to Ross)', "Phoebe: What are we gonna do? I'm starving.", 'Rachel: (gasps) Oh, I just remembered. We do have something to eat. Monica put something in our oven this morning.', 'Phoebe: Oh yeah!', 'Monica: Hey, you touch that and you will be sorry.']

chandler_dialogue: HA-HA! All you got was Monica's stinky Brussels sprouts!
intervening_dialogues: ["Rachel: Huh... OH MY GOD IT'S BRUSSELS SPROUTS. (they all look appalled)", "Ross: That's worse than no food."]

chandler_dialogue: Please let me stay on this side of the door.
intervening_dialogues: ['Monica: Stinky?!']

chandler_dialogue: The cranberries...?
intervening_dialogues: ['Rachel: Oh, I know... I still have my old key! (She goes in to get it and comes back with her keys) We can just unlock the door.', "Phoebe: Well, I don't know if that's such a good idea. They clearly don't want to be with us.", "Rachel: You know what? I don't want to be with them either, but it's Thanksgiving and we should not want to be together, together. It all looks so beautiful: the turkey, the stuffing...']

chandler_dialogue: He's doing that weird eye contact thing. Don't look at him, don't look at him! (They both look away)
intervening_dialogues: ["Monica: Oh! Enough! A monkey could have made 'em!", 'Joey: (still with his door wedged in the door gap, now opens his eyes wide and stares at Monica and Chandler as he did with Ross earlier in the hall) Hey listen guys, we feel really terrible.']

chandler_dialogue: The floating heads do make a good point.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Come on you guys, we want you to know we're (His eye widen even more) very very sorry. (Monica and Chandler are now covering their eyes with their hands) (then to the others in the hall) Right guys?", 'Ross: I feel terrible.', 'Phoebe and Rachel: So, so sorry.', "Joey: (smiling) Now let's not ruin this day. You worked so hard. Let's move past this and try to have a nice meal all together, huh?"]

chandler_dialogue: Well, you manheads aren't any better. You lied about going to the game. You knew it would make you late, and you still went anyway.
intervening_dialogues: ['Ross : So bad.', 'Phoebe: So bad.', "Monica: (Gets up) Okay, okay. You two (to Phoebe and Rachel) go get the dessert. (gives it to Monica).", 'Monica: Grand Supreme Little Darling?', 'Rachel: Congratulatioooons!', "Monica: Oh my God! YOU FORGOT THE PIES? Well, I cannot believe this. You force me to make dinner, then you're an hour late and you forget the one little thing that I asked you to do.", 'Ross: Really girls, not cool.']

chandler_dialogue: That would be a lot more convincing if you weren't drooling.
intervening_dialogues: ["Joey: Hey! I'm getting a little tired of this okay? We said we're sorry. It's Thanksgiving for Pete's sakes!
